Review title: If you still like it after all these plot holes...
Review_body:
...then stop reading this. I won't bother with the fact that the story progresses oh so slowly, nor with the repetitive music. I won't even fret over the amount of patience this series demands from you the way it drags certain scenes.I will just mention the 3 lapses of logic that baffle me.
Spoilers for Season 2 ahead1. The clown sceneMaybe if the scene took place in an open space, like a square, then it would make sense how a few clowns got the police confused. But the hospital has what? A couple of exits and entrances? And they were all covered by police officers. And when they saw the clowns, instead of lining them all up to question them, they just allow them to leave in peace. The most conspicuous of all the clowns was of course the cyberpunk Professor, who still managed to roam the hallways undetected. 
All the while 2 police officers were undercover in Angel's room pretending to be himself and his wife. And suddenly they see a doorknob turning...oh the suspense! The suspense built out of the logic that although all the hospital had cameras the one place the police didn't bother to cover was the hallway where their comatose witness was about to be attacked. And for all the disguised police force as doctors and nurses, not even one man was assigned to keep a lookout outside the room. Maybe a clown distracted them by making balloon animals.
2. I left you unconscious to prove I love youFirst of all, Salva, you are the worst boyfriend ever. Not only did you start this relationship out of pure self interest, you are so full of yourself that you feel the certainty that the woman is so infatuated by you, that even when handing her over a gun, she won't shoot you. A professional policewoman, that risked everything on this case, the one you betrayed and irreparably violated her trust, will let you go away, with not so much as even a bullet in your leg.
And you know what? She does exactly that. She actually lets him go. To what end? Even if she loves him, she knows that eventually she would get in trouble.3. Inspectora has a free pass because Casa de Papel LogicThe HQ is fully aware that the Inspectora has an affair with el Professor, so instead of interrogating and detaining her, they simple let her leave the premises. I was under the impression that in such grave situations when people's lives are on the line, even the slightest of suspicions are enough to keep a person in custody. But no, la Inspectora is only a suspect at that moment, and she also wants to go, so yeah, let her go. What could go wrong? After all she convinced you with the lamest line in all the series "I will prove to you I didn't know who that man was until recently, by giving up his whereabouts". Funny, because do you know who would also know this piece of information? His co-conspirator girlfriend. And when it turns out that the location she gives was not right (as any dedicated girlfriend would do in order to distract and delay the police) how do they react? They let her go, saying that only Angel can help them now. And she goes in the hospital, steals the badge and then Angel opens his eyes at such a convenient moment for the script that forces me to write all the above.La Casa de Papel has some likable characters and a promising premise. However, after all the slow progression even its good qualities start to wither and you are left with the aforementioned divorces with logic which are simply too much to swallow. The only way to enjoy this series is if it's the first one you have watched in you life or if you turn off your brain while watching it.

Review title: The TV version of a child celebrity. From adorable to terrible
Review_body: I am one of those people who loved the show at first it was interesting, it was exotic, it had charm.The evolution of it unfortunately is one of the worst I have ever seen in a TV show ever.The attention to details is none existant at this point. The constant trick where the audience sees the villan's plan and the hero does not is straight from children's plays. I honestly feel insulted by the writers and directors since they clearly must think the audience is this stupid.The characters' personality changes to fit the plot of every scene.You can see they used up every action movie cliche ever, cars shifting gears for no reason, guns clicking for no reason, spearing the life of a pshyco just to have him come back and do something worse.It is clear as day that the backstory is added just as they were prepearing a new season, just to make a death more dramatic. The timeline makes no sense, rewatch the first season and the characers' personality does not match.Worst of all is that all TV shows should try to educate people on some topics, whether it is engineering, medicine, economics, anything really. This shows gets everything wrong, all their discussions are munbo jumbo or highly inplauseable scenarios. Watching an episode at this point makes me feel guilty for waisting so much time.

This show really is awesome. So many characters but they all get their screen time and highlights. I'm always at the end of my seat watching this show! Great acting and the writing too. I'll be sad to see it end.

Review title: Superb, Simply stunning performances by the entire cast.
Review_body: Rarely does a film (movie/miniseries) grab you and take you on the ride of your life.The combination of exceptional writing, with an amazing plot, that takes more twists and turns than a formula one grand prix, and absolutely remarkable acting. All add up to one of the very best programs I have ever seen.This is groundbreaking, it is worldwide, and those of us in the U. S. A seem to be the last to the party !!.Each and every character is developed with great care and skillfully brought to life by actors who leave it all on the set. These actors, obviously gave it everything they had, and their talents are obvious. You become invested in every character, the good and the bad. The script and acting do something remarkable. It shows that each character is both good and bad, they are multi-dimensional as real people are, not stereotypical one dimensional characters that are so atrocious that they are only there to validate the violence of the main character.You feel these characters, you know they are all desperately looking for answers and meaning in there lives. They become bonded and are put through hell together. When each one slowly let's the other's into their hearts they lose them. It's a series of love stories, it is a drama, it is an action movie.Most of all it's a revolution !!Simply superb. I congratulate everyone involved in making this film. You all went from obscurity to being seen for what you really are, among to top escelion of your field.You should all win an Oscar. Individually and as a team.Thank you all for your hard work, dedication, talent and for never settling. You achieved something truly remarkable.

Review title: A soap opera in a Dali Mask.
Review_body:
I'm currently hate watching season 4 of the series.
If love geometry ( literally..triangles,squares) intrigues you..this might be the show for you..in case it's a thriller you want..all the okay scenes are already in the teasers and promos..so waste your time no further.This show doesn't have potholes..rather the plotholes have coalesced to create some semblance of a story.However here a few glaring plotholes from season 4:1. 5 years..the governor and chief of security
of the Bank of Spain and even the secretary remain the same..all have fixed terms.2. Nairobi had braided hair when she was shot at the end of season 3..post her surgery ( by Drx. Tokyo of course) she now has straight hair and even some lipstick and the first thing she does after a near assassination..of course..romance with Bogota.3.Gandia's blood falls for the first time in the library..when he was clearly leaking in the surgery room itself.4. Even despite Arturito's repeated antics..no one can just tie him to a chair and gag him..he's left unsupervised like always.5. Stockholm shot at cops in the first robbery..now she has issues with Denver's aggression when he is punching a guy she clearly knows is trying to manipulate Denver.This is just for this part and episode..you can imagine how the rest of the show is like.P.S : Showmakers..stop spoon feeding us and please cut the annoying narration of the show's worst character..Tokyo.

Review title: Good idea, but drifting away so often wears it out
Review_body: The first few episodes of the 1st season are killers and they get the viewer hooked up. Good direction, costume design, ideas on the plot, cast. acting.But somehow all this seems to end around episode 4 or 5, when the show becomes a mashup of anything. It's full of meaningless backstory that comes along with the actual happening and there is no room for the viewer to connect the dots. I can't explain without a spoiler but I will give a metaphoric example:Say that the protagonist has a stain on his shirt. It's meaningless right? Well the show will throw a flashback on how the stain got there. For once or twice it's ok but it does it so many times that it starts feeling like an interruption for advertisements. It's trully tiring and my patience only got me to episode 11, two episodes before the season closure that I trully don't care what will happen. Netflix should add a button "skip flashback" specially for this show.

I binge watched the first two seasons over a course of two days. It was fun, entertaining, stylish, clever and with some quite likeable characters. It wasn't perfect and had plenty of flaws but it made for great watching and the cliffhanger episodes made me watch "just one more" when I should probably have been sleeping. I really liked this show. It really was fun. But it should have ended there. Sadly it did not.Enter season 3. I don't know if the writers and director of the original got replaced, or simply lost the plot, but I didn't make it past episode 4. And that was 2 too many.
I will try to block out ever seeing them so I still can fondly remember the first 2 great seasons.3 comes across like a cheap fan made spinoff, created by an angsty 15 year old antifa kid who really really really wants to be in with the Kool Kids at anonymous, and is an outspoken feminist in order to impress girls and get laid. The stylishness of first has been totally replaced by cheezyness, the once likeable characters feel forced and are annoying, and any realism and grittiness has given way to absurdity.Nope. Season 3 never happened. Do yourself a favor and pretend it doesn't exist.
9/10 for the very entertaining first two seasons.

We have to admit that this series will be one of the top 10 series in history.!
Like If you agree?

Review title: Not bad, but still so overrated.
Review_body:
First of all, I think this is my first review (so please be nice!) but I felt it necessary cause when I was watching the show I took a glimpse at this page and saw an average 8,7 rating, which left me a bit surprised, especially when some other movies or series here are receiving very short ratings. Well, as I'm saying in the title, this isn't a bad tv show. I enjoyed it and I watched it in 3 days, but I'd give this not more than a 6,5 or 7 stars rating.The plot (some guys trying to rob the spanish royal mint) is good and haunts you in the first episodes, of course it's a tv series so it doesn't have to be totally realistic and in the first part, as I said, the whole thing works well. The acting is ok and so is the script.
But at a certain point the characters become so dumb that you can't really believe it's a serious script. I won't spoiler anything but they start making choices that no-one would ever make in any situation, and I tend to consider Bank Robbing as a quite dangerous one.
I'm well aware of what the "suspension of disbelief" is and I'm totally convinced of its importance while watching or reading fictional products, but here they go a little bit further.But, most important in my not-so-good review is: I strongly hated most of the characters, they're unbearable, they're stupid, they make you want to kill them every time they open their mouths. And if you are rational human beings you'll probably hate them too.By the way, if you just want to relax watching something intriguing without having heavy mental efforts, then go on. :)

One of the best tv series ever, full of drama . amazing acting from all the actors and actresses. It's a must watch series. Puta Mierrdaaa

Review title: Amateurs Plan the Heist of the Century
Review_body:
A bunch of undisciplined amateurs plan an 'Ocean's Eleven' style heist at The Spanish Mint. It all goes terribly awry because they ... well, behave like amateurs. It's well paced and makes for some good entertainment, but I'm not buying the underlying premise of this ragtag bunch somehow being capable of planning the heist of the century. It reminds me of the sci-fi movie Sunshine (2007) where a bunch of our 'finest' astronauts mess up their mission to save the earth.

Review title: Somewhere between Inside Man and Days of our lives
Review_body:
If you're looking for a show that has the best and worst elements of Days of our Lives, The Room and Inside man, then you've come to the right placeAfter about ten episodes in season 1, I really dont know what is happening.
The plot is all over the place and side plots pop up every 15 minutes, and dont seem to lead anywhere and are buried again. The character development is so odd and illogical and sometimes you feel you've missed 2-3 episodes. Without spoiling anything here are a few examples. Someone is drunkdialing a colleague about how much they love them and refer to a past affair, and the next day, it never happened.
Suddenly the logical somewhat likeble guy is turned to be the bad guy and back again to a good guy (?) And then everything is forgotten. The intellegence officer and the negotiator start out with a pissing contest and you are lead to believe that there is stuff thats "above the negotiator paygrade" that are happening. And then theres is nothing happening and everything is A okay.
The group of robbers are first presented as a solid, well drilled, best of the best the country has to offer and all of them have bags of experience from past jobs.
After 10 episodes however..
These are the most unprofessional, no discipline, unloyal, reckless, childish robbers you will ever see and how they ever completed a past job is beyond me. I wouldnt trust them stealing a nickle from my blind and deaf grandmom.The acting is mediocre at best and I cant really point anyone out that is above that.Im going out on a limb here and guess that this show is aimed at spanish talking housewives in the age of 50-70 years that probably have all of DAYS recorded on VHS and are looking to simething similar.Im really surprised the rating this show has (currently 8.6). It has mediocre written all over and therefore no higher than a 5/10 from me.
Unless the writers are some out of this world geniuses andd somehow weave all the plots together in a season finale.cult status potentiale though

All season are going crazy,hats off to the team,all the best,every single character is unique

Review title: Did not like it, did not like it, DID NOT LIKE IT!!!
Review_body: First, the members of the crew are not gunman and women all of a sudden, from episode 1 all the way to 5 its guns guns guns, no inteligent plans that the professor is well-known for. Literally all the planning is around how to kill. The heist is focused on in the first 2 episodes, the rest is guns blazing.Secondly, in a small corridor oppositions shoot machine guns, grenades, and rocket launchers etc but none of the heist crew gets any fatal wounds. They fight against opposition after opposition throughout the first 4 episodes with snipers on roofs but they pull through with ease. They took the level of lies to a whoooole new level!!!Lastly, they show some scenes of the past that have very little connection or meaning to the actual heist they're currently in. Maybe they'll reveal the connection in the next episodes, who knows? For example, Berlin is shown teaching his son how to steal gold in a different completely unrelated heist. And other scenes of the character's pasts, like how Tokyo's boyfriend was killed, useless past.Not impressed, AT ALL. It's very ordinary, low standard compared to the previous 4 parts.

Review title: Fast-paced, fun, and really really stupid :)
Review_body:
Just as title says. It's really fun to watch, but this is basically soap opera disguised in "action-crime-mistery". Just one plot hole after another, the weird character (the creep who wants to be the hostage just to get laid - season 3 & 4), really funny scenes with our main actors talking about love problems while catching this really bad and dangerous guy.. It's naive & stupid & a true quilty pleasure to watch :)

Review title: A Masterpiece and Mind Boggling Series
Review_body:
If you are looking for a series that gives you feeling of thrill,action,suspense,romance,crime etc then you have chosen the right series.
Starting from Unknown people to becoming the loved ones of the public and to each other,the journey was wonderful and connecting. The Heist didn't felt any boring or unrealistic. I mean the concept of whole is worth watching and the actors have added more stars and a full moon to it.
The master mind Direction to the well scripted writing everything was planned and phenomenal.
I must suggest you to watch this series and after that you will be more attentive and observatory in life. This series not only entertains us but also give us so many messages and lesson that are so helpful in real life.
Go for it.
Although i am waiting for Season 5 to arrive very eagerly.
Love from INDIA.
Bella Ciao Bella Ciao!

Review title: Downfall of a show that was once the TV show of the decade
Review_body:
Every successful television show follows the same pattern. Take Prison Break for example, season 1 is a must watch for every person who watches TV. season 2 is great. 3 is fine. 4 is bad. 5 is not worth watching.
The first season of money heist is a spanish and worldwide master piece in the world of movies and shows. It's the TV show of the decade. Season 2 is really great but not like the first. While it is nearly impossible to find holes in the plot of the 1st season. Holes can be easily noticed in the plot of season 2. I didn't buy the incidents that happened in season 2. The plot wasn't carefully developed. But still season 2 is still amazing, great, and a must watch. Money Heist is still the TV show of the decade with those 2 seasons.
Now you would think that season 3 should be great or good. But since Netflix put their hands on this show and since Netflix ruins everything they touch, the whole plot is overwhelmed with holes, it really suck. The first episode of season 3 is ridiculous. How the story started again is pathetic in terms of creativity. The main characters of the show could have appeared on the first episode on season 3 and said we will start another operation because netflix told us to do so and it wouldn't make a difference. If the 1st season of this show started the same way it did with the 3rd season, it wouldn't even be famous in Spain. And the music is horrible. Too many songs like it is an "American Pie" movie or something. I guess the budget provided by Netflix was spent carelessly. And then, season 4. The joke. I reached the middle of it and then I stopped. I just read the spoilers to know what's gonna happen so that I can follow up when season 5 comes out even though I am fully prepared for an extreme disappointment. Season 4 is when the bad guy(s) turn into the spanish version of robocop or terminator. It is really disgusting. The good guys become one of those hundreds of soldiers that die one by one against Steven Segal, Chuck Norris, Arnold Schwarzenegger, you name it.
So in short season 1 and 2 are like the true horror films. 3 and 4 are the "scary movies" that make fun of the originals.

Loved this series. It was far fetched at time but not far enough to not be possible. Loved the story, loved the characters. Special mention to the voice over artists exc Nairobi?? A number of twists. Enjoyable TV! Thanks for the journey.

Review title: this is too painful to watch
Review_body:
There's literally not a single actress or actor in this series who doesn't annoy. it hurts, watching the series. it hurts a lot. The logic of the plot is completely beyond me.
there is one guy, the brain, the professor. he seems to be very intelligent, but then he selects a team of "professionals", who is the complete opposite of being professional. I mean, every single episode, you have to deal with at least 30 minutes, watching these guys behave like drunk teenagers on their first date.
this reminds me of mission impossible, or oceans eleven, but the complete opposite.
don't watch it. seriously. it hurts.

The best work I ever watched lately. That harmony was great between characters and music in this serie.
What can I say more:)I hope we can see more great works, like this one.

Review title: One of the best series I've watched in a while
Review_body: I usually don't like non-fantasy themed series if they are not exceptionally good, but for this I made an exception since I've heard good things.All I can say is that I'm glad I did. It's one of the best series I've watched in a while and for sure it's the best non-american series for me.The cast is great, with great acting and the writing is incredible. You like most of the characters and you want to see what happens next for them. The concept is pretty simple but that's not bad. It's very realistic and it doesn't have many no-logic writing just to save the protagonists and that's always a plus for me.Worth mentioning: For me, a good series needs to have good soundtracks and I'm happy to say that they have the right soundtrack for every scene, action-packed, emotional etc.All in all, if you like the concept of a mastermind making chess like moves to win his opponent then you should give this a try.

First three episodes had me interested. Then I began growing tired of the flashbacks and character development. By the end of Part 1 after FF through much of it, I watched a few episodes of Part 2 and once again couldn't take the slow pace, so right to the last 40 minutes I went. What an ending! I must tell others - do not waste your time.

Review title: The complete lack of logic at all.
Review_body:
The story is about one group of idiots trying to catch another group of idiots. The series where you can't believe in what happens in every scene. Are you head of the police operation group? Who cares - just drink and date during your duty. Did you catch the suspect? Just hold him in an abandoned building. Are you a robber who holds hostages and doesn't want to kill them? Just don't wear a mask. Of course, they will not portrait you for police. Are you a genius criminal? Just use your real name. Etc... The lack of logic in every fcknig scene.

Review title: Brilliant television worth the binge - 4 days??
Review_body:
From my perspective this is one of the most entertaining and exciting tv series that I have seen in 50 years. And thank god it did not come from the English speaking studios that fall into the same repetitious pattern of predictable boredom. The cast is beyond stunning, the plot intriguing and the acting beyond reasonable expectation. I'm usually overly critical and cynical I always look for the obvious to break the story to no more than an average reality that the plot tries to over represent. Can't do it this time despite the cultural difference. Though I have to admit I keep looking, but this is too good.

The show runners seem to be trying hard to add every usual element of your average group heist series/film, To mention a few: the extremely smart mastermind who plans everything ahead of time and foresees all possible scenarios and problems (same person also turns into a martial arts expert or an assassin, or a lover boy when necessary), the psychopathic group leader, the tough guy, etc. The problem is this team that the supreme leader gathers is so incompetent and unprofessional that a month long heist starts to go south on day one! And not for the right reasons too!
On the other team, there is this super police captain who is so weak and incompetent she seems to spend more time solving her issues and fixing her own mess rather than focusing on a heist that caught the attention of the nation!Enjoyed a couple of laughs watching season 1, but that's it for me!

Review title: Don't listen to people..found season 3.4 more thrilling than 1.2
Review_body:
I enjoyed the show even with so many blunders n mistakes..its entertaining thats all you need ENTERTAINMENT..All those people complaining about how stupid its is and everything should quit watching TV shows n movies..i am surprised that there is hardly any negative comments about season DARK which is just so boring and repetitive in season 2 where every character time travels whereever they want and it just screws up your brain..why people dont try to find logic there as they are trying really hard to prove how non sense money heist is..it is non sense but its damn entertaining and keeps u on the edge from season 1 to 4..i almost quit after season 2 when heard so many negative reviews about 3.4 but i actually found 3.4 more thrilling and action packed just because there was no stupid Raquel leading the force and wasting time on stupid negotiations over the phone where now police was more on the front foot to give robbers a hard time which made it fun because they knew after the first heist that these robbers are no threat to hostages and bunch of jokers..lol..

This is a well-directed and exciting series. It is brilliant in showing how a heist should work, and it is realistic but... You wish it was more sorrow into it. Yes, they lose some members in their "team" but besides that, they solve every possible obstacle that they face. It doesn't get that exciting when you know that in the end, they will overcome whatever their opponents do (the military, the police). If they suffered, and that the professor wouldn't be all like "hey I have a plan for this", one would sit and be excited about how they would get out, when something doesn't go according to plan. I like this series, thus my high rating, but it would be better if the robbers wouldn't be so successful all the time and face difficulties.

A great series made with great taste. The actors seemed to settle in perfectly. Everything was to be loved about it.

Almost everything about this show is awful. Who on earth did the casting? Most of this gang cannot act. The worst example is the son of that bearded guy. Cringe over cringe. He can't even fake laugh. Giggles like a toddler the whole time so much that you wish he is going to be first one to get shot to take him out of his misery. All the pretended coolness is so cringeworthy. The ridiculous "Pulp Fiction"-style discussion over the masks in the back of the truck almost made me burn down my house with fire.The gang leader wants to make you puke particularly in the scene where the hostages are lined and he goes from one to the next and whispering them cringe into their ears. Trying to be so cool, but nope, he is not. Ughh. According to the trailer, it is revealed that nobody takes him serious anyway. Then the scene where the bearded guy "cracks" the 60cm thick main safe door with a simple blow torch. LOL. He cuts through a surprising only 1cm "thick" metal cover like through butter and then pops it open with an off the shelf screwdriver in under 5 minutes - what a joke. Really? The Spanish National Mint's main safe is that easy to open? Have these people never watched other movies to see how it's done? And all this time they are so adamant about being incognito - except 3 of them being unmasked for most of the time. And the hacker dude - clickety-click - fist pump, hacked the whole system with a GUI using Visual Basic. And forget about a one night stand - our "Little Lamb" seems to be after a one hour stand. The scene with the selfie is unreal. It's her phone - why is she panicking? And how does that dude think the photos will go viral - photos are still on her phone! The main character in search of "Little Lamb" is literally checking every executive room (rooms where teenagers would never dare to enter to make out) except the most logical places - the goddamn bathrooms! So many movie mistakes in 1 single episode. The big hairy brother dudes were introduced as the only weapon experts, yet everyone is running around like Rambo. Not a single scene was shown what in those 5 months has happened. Not a single scene showing the crew being trained in how to use a weapon. Alas the sad scenes where they shoot like in a cartoon. Spray and pray, I guess. Although, apparently the love birds had sex every day in those 5 months. In those 5 months there wasn't even a proper briefing by the "Professor". It is a miracle how he tracked down the main character. Not only tracked down but took those surveillance photos of her granny's house and then promptly drove to her to recruit her. How the hell did he know which public phone booth she was using? The list goes on and on. And this was only episode 1.All those 10/10 reviews must be Spaniards who are voting purely out of patriotism or have never seen a good show/movie before. I could barely finish episode 1. I had no more cringe-energy left towards the end. I should have known better because the trailer alone gave hints about the cringe-levels of this abomination.You want to watch a proper recent heist movie? Watch Army of Thieves. There are many many examples out there.

The trailer was intriguing, the user ratings suggested it would be good, but but but.. it just wasn't. I didn't care for the characters or the back stories, I got bored and quit after episode 4. Shame.

The Professor is one hell of a nerd you can think about. He's got everything planned, every small detail. Even the way he runs at the scrapyard is so damn authentic. Berlin is a piece of art. His theories and ideologies makes you fall in love with him.
I leave it for you to have your take and experience an extraordinary take of heist.
Eagerly waiting for Season 5.

Review title: A Long Soap Opera of Inept Robbers and Police
Review_body: While some of the technical genius of the robbers is very interesting, the series just drags on and on and on. You see flashback or robbers you don't care for as they all have their broken down issues. Amazingly stupid to think their plan was going to work. Then we have the inept police. For a long time, they kept shooting and hit no one (ok, they finally hit a robber in a later episode). But, the viewer has to be brain dead to take this all in. The lead detective falls in love with the lead robber, all kinds of mistakes by police are made, lead detective finally figures it out and captures the mastermind at gunpoint. Does she call her police allies and come and take him off to jail? Nope. She takes him to the old hideout, interrogates him, and ultimately lets him escape. How stupid is that? I found myself screaming at the TV to her. I have not finished the whole series yet, but I am ready to shut it off if they don't get through that tunnel and escape pretty soon. It goes on, and on, and on! zzzzzzzz

More than worst. Just a fckng waste of time.
Dont waste time watchinf this just watch
'Spartacus' and you will be amazed by seeing.

Review title: Bad acting, plot holes, terrible dialogs. But kind of fun.
Review_body:
The first season is ok, fun at some points, so you almost forget all the bad.
Maybe if the show was shorter it could be rated 5/6.Episodes after episodes, the action is replaced by a soap-like melo-drama, where the life and feelings of the protagonists are more important than the heist.You are lead to think that the robbers are deep interestng people, but the artificial chaos created around them and their illogical and irresponsible reaction to that only makes all of them fools and unprofessional.What they try to tell you:
Profesional robbers with high expertisePerfect plan that anticipate everythingWhat you actually have:
Unprofesional robbers that act like teenagers and can't handle any contrarietyPlot holes with inconsistant behaviors, reactions and situations

Review title: Highlights of the film and my personal opinion
Review_body: One of the best movies and a good director and a great acting team.The first 4 seasons were both daunting and painful due to the loss of some team members, and for every plan they had that had already been drawn, they stole a throwback to the previous time, which paved the way for the formation of their plan.The remarkable point of the film was that after T's death, the story was not told in his own language and it was a point that surprised me.Another point that he had in the last season after the painful incident that happened was that Rio was not the weak point of the team, but Denver took his place, and at the beginning of the movie, the professor said that during the robbery, you should separate love so that there is no problem. Now, until the first 5 seasons, Rio and Tokyo were the problem of the team, but in Part 2, Season 5, Denver became the team's weakness.In short, it was a film in which in each episode and sequence, when a problem arose outside the bank or inside the viewer, he measured all the possible possibilities in his mind, but suddenly, by solving that problem, the interactions of the mind were disrupted.It was a good movie. I hope the spin-off of the Berlin movie is also good.

I guess people who give bad reviewers about this series needs to love their life a little more.. this series is a masterpiece in all aspects catch you from scene one once you start you just cant stop.

Review title: Please don't waste your time unless you enjoy Chuck Norris
Review_body:
Take a mastermind, the ones that could predict every move in every situation, take 12 Chuck Norris and put them on a money heist. This is what Money Hesit is, plus the robbers have cheat codes activated (infinite money and infinite ammo), and put them against the dumbest police force a kid can imagine. A total waste of time and a great offense to human intellect.
If you have sympathy for thieves and robbers in genre you could enjoy this series, but if you have a decent brain, try to avoid like hell this series

Watching the 1st three episodes of Season 1, one can already predict the future of this series. It's like watching noontime soap opera. The "profile" of the characters, who were first and foremost selected due to their "hard core" "nothing to loose" personas is completely contradictory to the way they unfolded themselves in every episode. Too many irrelevant and stupid scenes (constant recall of Berlin's wedding unless Tatiana turns out to be Sierra!) and characters (Arturo for one!), Racquel sitting for hours in front of Alicia saying nothing when she was once one of the best hostage negotiators, Robbers making a mockery of themselves in front of their hostages by bickering and contradicting each other, the professor getting annoying by the minute. I think the writers under estimated the intellect of the viewers. I can't believe they killed Nairobi's character when she is the one compensating for the stupidity of the others. Overall, the series doesnt have the charm of Italian Job and the thrill of The Bank Job. If the viewers want to have some netflix excitement- i highly recommend Vis a Vis (Locked Up). Stay safe everyone!

La Casa De Papel, Part 4After a Successful Heist at the Royal Mint of Spain, The Professor and his team try to take on Bank of Spain and this time it's not for Cash, but Gold. This plan, however, is made to extricate Rio, from the police who have taken him prisoner unofficially in a remote undisclosed location.This season gives us more reasons to believe it's just not about the heist, it's about resistance, Resistance to the Govt and the Police, and very well depicted with the song Bella Ciao, which is not the theme song but it has given a strong identity to the series, the impact of this song is so huge that whenever you may listen to Bella Ciao, you will think of Money Heist.Money Heist Part 4 Let the Chaos Begin:-
Like the first 3 seasons, this one will also keep you on the edge of your seat, right from when Nairobi was shot in the last episode of Part 3, you are keen to know whether she will live or not, Professor who thinks Lisbon is dead in Part 4 can be seen mourning gut-wrenchingly leading you to think why did they have to kill Lisbon? Until suddenly, the episode starts getting interesting after the professor's conversation with Tokyo when he explains how Lisbon was executed.In the throes of mourning Lisbon's death, The professor let his guard down and it was interesting to see how he tries to make a daring and dangerous escape from the police. Will he escape, of course, he will...it's no surprise that the Professors brain thrives, especially in dreadful situations.If you missed Berlin, he is back in a Flashback that is based around his wedding, his plan to steal gold and his love for Palermo.The 1st Episode of Part4 is named Game Over, not yet obviously as there are 7 more episodes to go.
In this one as Arturo the annoying character comes back he tries to create a rift between Denver and Monica while trying to win the trust of hostages in planning a revolt, but no one wants to listen to him this time. Arturo fails to have an impact on us in this part.The intensity of the Negotiations between Alicia, the pregnant police appointed negotiator and Lisbon is very gripping, and when you think Lisbon is about to reveal everything, the professor comes up with yet another mastermind twist where he makes contact with his love Lisbon through Colonel Tomayo's assistant, Benito. How the Professor gets policeman Benito to work for him is another interesting episode.If you thought there were many annoying characters like Arturo or Inspector Alicia, then here comes Gandia, The Chief security officer for the governor of the Bank of Spain, it was interesting to see the way he escapes the captivity and how he turns out to be a single yet a strong threat for the Professor and his team, he does succeed for a bit and ends up killing one of the key members in the professor's team.So a lot of engrossing situations arise simultaneously, Lisbon is being interrogated at the tent outside Bank of Spain, Inside Gandia is creating havoc while the gold Is being melted and outside the Professor is desperately making a plan to save his team.The Episodes are so gripping that you wouldn't blink an eye, especially when the Professor plans to save Lisbon while she is being transferred to the court and that is when the Paris plan gets activated. The professor successfully creates a rift between the pregnant negotiator Alicia and her boss Tamayo....but how Alicia gets back to the professor is something you will enjoy watching in the last episode, for once there is someone as smart and crazy to match up to the level of the professor. It ends with Alicia and the Professor standing face to face with a gun on his head. We are eagerly waiting for Part 5 to see what happens next. Will the professor be caught? Or will the team successfully fly the coop with gold?Interesting Facts :- Nairobi's Name was supposed to be Cameroon, The Professor was supposed to be the narrator, the makers then decided on Moscow because of his subtle and light-hearted tone, but finally settled with Tokyo as the narrator. The location used to shoot the Bank of Spain is a govt complex called New Ministries....The Salvador Dali Masks they used is not the only ones they thought of, they were going to use Don Qui-Jote's image, but settled for Dali masks as they were more striking, infact bollywood actors are so inspired by the professors character that National Award Actor Ayushman khurana posted a video of him wearing glasses and playing bella ciao on his piano and Kartik Aryan also posted a look similar to that of the professor.
Season 4 episode 6 was my final episode.. I won't finish the serial without Nairobi !!
Season 4 ep 6 was my last episode. I won't finish it without Nairobi. Go to hell!

Review title: Money Heist Season 4 : A story which keeps you glued to screen.
Review_body: Money Heist or La Casa De Papel Season 4 has been released on Netflix globally on 3rd April 2020. It is one of the few foreign language Series which got so popular in few time in India.The 3rd season left everyone in shock and mystery and if you are thinking this season is going to be last and will have all the answers, well I'm sorry but it doesn't. This season is filled with more shocks and twists. Like previous seasons, this season also keeps you thrilled and surprised.As usual there is suspense in the end of every episode. So you can't delay it, you get addicted. Dialogues are main masterpieces, some of them have a new kind of feeling and inspiring level.At first it was just a team, but the way everyone gets bonded like family is shown fabulously. At some point it feels like real life, you will forget it's a fictional story, and that's much you are going to love it. Negative characters are also real gems in this story, you keep hating them on every step till the end. Small things like flashbacks, lunches, love stories, songs, celebrations, Denver's laugh makes you happy, feel loved and keeps you emotionally attached to the story. The scene where Helsinki plays Harmonica for Nairobi's funeral is real heart touching.Character development is amazing in this season. For example at starting you hated Palermo but as you start to know him more and more you are going to love him. Just like when everyone hated Berlin in Season 1, but ended up loving him in the end of Season 2.Whenever you lose hope and feel like whole plan is failed now and everyone's gonna die or going to jail at that moment the professor touches his spectacle and smiles at that moment a small smile appears on your face too without you knowing. And then you know this guy also have planned for this situation, and just in few minutes professor takes control of whole situation.It is a must watch series before you die.

I dont know the whole series was good, this is about season 5. I just feel you cannot just kill a main character like tokyo like that, i feel she was the light of the whole series. I dont know man i dont feel like watching this anymore haha.

This is a total waste of time, and it doesnot even worth watching.
Very bad writing and full of fillers, despite the good first seson but all that follows is uust rubbish and the ratings show that people didnot like the growth of the characters nor the heist storylines or dialogues.
I really donot recommend it to anyone, it was a waste of time and money really.

I signed up on IMDB just to post this review because the show is so bad. It is bad because it is absurd.Almost all the main characters are irritating at best and disgusting at worst. A heist planned by a supposed-genius who chooses absolute idiots for the team. In reality no one would sympathize with them. What's even more absurd is when you consider the time frame (under a week) that the entire story takes place. Yes, truth is sometimes stranger than fiction but the level of ridiculous in this show is off the charts. I'd rather watch SpongeBob SquarePants if I wanted mindless entertainment, at least it makes me laugh instead of wanting to punch my monitor. It is truly an insult to every group of people portrayed in the show.

Review title: 3 good hours of TV drawn out to 20+ hours
Review_body: How many hours of TV can you spend focused on a single robbery? Half way through the first season, it ran out of steam and got awfully soap opera like. I made it through 13 episodes of season one thinking the heist would be resolved, but was totally frustrated that I have to get through season two (at least) before the original crime is even done. Seems like somebody said 'how can we drag a crime or for the longest possible duration - then double it and add a few extra hours of cheesy unrealistic love triangles for good measure.Maybe seasons 2 and 3 turn three series around, but I'm not going to invest the time to find out...

There is only one error. You steal gold from the reserves of a European state like Spain and you celebrate it by saying bella ciao. There is not one poor person in this country. Come on, you can steal the money stolen through corruption in Turkey, for example, 128 billion dollars and distribute them to the public, or you can buy it yourself, it's not a problem. The real heroism is hidden in this. If you do it in Spain, you're a terrorist. But if you do it in Turkey, at least you know that the money doesn't go to useless politicians. In this respect, I think the show is illogical and the thieves are not praiseworthy.

Review title: Money Heist is worth to watch!!
Review_body: A band of robbers, lead by a man known simply as 'the Professor', infiltrate and rob the Spanish National Mint. They appear to bungle it, ending up holed up in the Mint with 67 hostages. But it's all part of the Professor's plan. If it succeeds, they'll make off with over $2 billion Euros.Entertaining, initially, and could have been a masterpiece. The initial plot - the plan to secure the Mint and make off with over $2 billion Euros - was very clever and intriguing. It was also engaging: you got to know the individual characters of the heisters, as well as who they were up against. From here on I expected a taught, gritty battle of wits and wills between the robbers and the police.Unfortunately, that didn't happen. Instead of being tight, the plot diverged into silly escapades. One escapade lead to another: robber has to fix some error, fixes it, unwittingly causes another issue, now has to fix that, rinse and repeat. What's worse, the errors, solutions and escapades were incredibly implausible, just being antics for action sake.In addition, having established their characters in the first few episodes, the robbers then do several things counter to their characters. It was as if the writers wrote each scene independent of what had happened before. It could not have been more random if they brought in a different writer for each episode, and told them not to read the scripts of the previous episodes.The further into the series one went, the worse it got. During the first season the good, clever plot developments generally outweighed the random, implausible, stupid ones. By Season Two it was open season, with dumb stuff being the norm. The dumb plot developments became predictable, eg you have a situation where a character has a choice and the logical thing, the thing people would do 100% of the time in real life, is to do A. However, A would mean the series ends, so the character does B, and the series continues.So the plot only makes sense if you're mind-bogglingly stupid.By the end I just wanted it to be over, so my intelligence would no longer be insulted. And yet it still got drawn out, by about 2-3 episodes too many.And apparently there's a Season 3 in the works. Considering how it ended, not sure how that's possible, but the producers did manage to turn what should have been a 8-or-so episode mini-series into a 2-season, 22-episode series.

The first two seasons of this show are so good. Absolute must watch. The show should've really ended after them though. Or maybe after a "Where are they now" mini season. All of the characters had their arcs finished and the ending was all around satisfying. But Netflix saw that the show had become a global phenomenon after they had bought it, and decided to make a few extra bucks by continuing the already finished show by making three big budget seasons.Netflix's decision probably paid off for the actors and Netflix themselves, but the show's quality suffered a lot from it. What was originally a 9/10 show turned into a 7 or 6 /10. The writing got a lot worse, the show got turned into more of more of a action show compared to the first two seasons which were more of a thriller (which originally made it so good), and there was nobody to fill the void after the death of the charismatic Berlin. Although Netflix really tried to fill that void with Palermo, they did not succeed at it. He is just inferior in every way. Also Murillo's successor Sierra is nearly not as good and relatable of an inspector as Murillo was.After finishing the show yesterday I can say that the last three seasons had some emotional and good moments, but they still fail to outshine the well written and thought out first two seasons. Netflix didn't ruin the show completely by any means, they just made it a lot worse by continuing an already finished story.

An absolute MUST WATCH This show is absolutely bangin I love legit every heist member. Nairobi is sooo fire, Berlin is the perfect admirable manic, and Tokyo has more balls then all of them. Like you literally scream when they win any small battle like your favorite sports team just scored a goal. I find myself legit caring about the characters and their fates, this is how you make a series, movie, etc.. I don't ever want it to end!

Review title: It's good but not as good as they claim it to be.
Review_body:
It starts with a strong note, a good story and great characters but soon it starts falling down from reality to fiction and filmy story..
I would have preferred if they had stuck to the original story of a brilliant perfect plan and conquering obstacle instead of over using the Stockholm syndrome to a level where even police would start to help them.
By the time the second season ends, I just wanted to quit watching it but I was hopeful it would get better. It didn't.
Somehow it convinces you by the end of the show that robbers were good people and the police was bad in trying to save the people.
I don't know why they wanted to glorify the robbers and showcase the bank robbery as a great revolutionary thing.
None had done any great service to anyone by robbing the mint.
Who were they fighting against and what was the resistance?
It turned from a brilliant series to a extremely stupid one in a very short time.
I still don't know what the craze is all about.

Review title: Americans don't understand LCDP. It's deeper, than just a heist.
Review_body: What started as an ambiguous show on a Spanish TV channel, became one of the most popular shows in the world. There has never been a more popular TV series not in the english language. And i'm glad Netflix shared this amazing show to the world.If it highlighted one thing, it is that many Americans still don't understand Europeans and their style of film making. They are so accustomed only to their shows, they can't fandom anything that is presented to them from outside.One of the major "flaws" i see being brought up is that the characters are unrealistic and not believable. On the contrary, i think they perfectly show the real human nature. Real people, real emotions, different situations, with their highs and lows. It's something you will see, if such things happened to a regular person. European film makers have always showed more feelings in their work, because Europeans are that way.Many Americans expected an action heist series, with their typical robot characters seen in every criminal / police shows, who are always cool under pressure, never miss a shot, know what to do in every situation... LCDP is not like that. Every character enters in the heist with a job, but their actions are fueled much more by their inner feelings, their scares, their beliefs, their struggles, their dreams. They can't be perfect all the time. Of course they will make mistakes, of course they will make snap-decisions without thinking. Every person will act that way in such high-tense circumstances.The character relationships is the base and what makes LCDP.

It is an amazing show! I enjoyed every second of it.

Review title: One of the best Netflix titles out right now
Review_body:
Netflix has a knack for knowing what its viewers would like. I didn't think so when I saw this title keep popping up on the home screen. I ignored it for a good 2-3 weeks before I bit the bullet. After all, I'm learning Spanish so why not get a little vocab practice, right? The first episode took some adjusting to; this is the first (but not last) Spanish-language TV show I've seen. Patiently watch the first 2-3 episodes then you'll be rewarded with a ride like nothing you've experienced before. I was on the edge of my seat - all without the usual tropes used in English-language shows. It was a wholesome kind of experience. I can't explain it any other way. Do yourself a favour - if you have the day off, block out 8 hours to finish Part 1. Then ask your boss for another day off to power through Part 2. I'm not a bingewatcher these days, but the cliffhangers in this show make it impossible to wait!

Don't let the good score and reviews fool you.La Casa De Papel IS NOT about a heist. La Casa De Papel IS NOT about their plan. La Casa De Papel is just another teenage drama speaking spanish rather than english.I love the european cinema. It always calls my attention because contrary to Hollywood, I have the feeling they always try to innovate their formulas, and La Casa De Papel is no different.As I mentioned, it's a teenage drama. And yes, it's innovative because of its heist background-a merit I can't deny.But don't get me wrong: their innovativeness fails in every aspect but the innovation itself.Characters are all dumb, including acting-except Berlin,-omnipresent plot holes, stereotypes everywhere, and the problems they face aren't intelligently or logically resolved.Most of the solutions are improvised-despite the months on planning to actually perform the heist,-gambling-based, or poorly developed. When they can't think in something that doesn't fit any of these categories, there's the last resort: a very stupid, irrational bi-polar character called Rio which is the xXYoung_HackerXx that has the superpowers of create bombs, bypass any security system created by the most advanced security companies of Spain, go to the gym and shoot with guns-all this alone, by the age of 19 and at once! The new McGayver is Spanish!If you like a teenage drama, go for it. It really has the merit of entertain, but hardly fails when it comes to seriousness. If you are looking for a detailed, well-executed with great acting heist piece, just forget it. There's no brilliance here. At all. And oh, the ending is just... bad. Predictable to say the least.

Review title: This is only for "Kids"! Not even the LOCKDOWN STUFF!!
Review_body: I think this is getting popular because nowdays more and more teenagers have started to watch serieses and started to watch NETFLIX and PRIME VIDEOS (all beacuse of free/cheap internet connection across the country). The teenagers who are not having knowledge of what is the CLASS THING, what is MUST WATCH and what is MUST NOT WATCH. And another reason must be the LOCKDOWN across the world.I have seen and liked all seasons of BREAKING BAD, PEAKY BLINDERS, GAME OF THRONES, SHERLOCK HOLMES, NARCOS, PRISON BREAK, PAATAL-LOK, SACRED GAMES, MIRZAPUR (Yes, I am Indian). This is for you to know which kind of person I am.Whenever any movie or series getting famous (if I don't know much about its Director or Actors), I ask my friends whether it is worth or not. And I think all of us do this. This series was also being popular, none of my friends had watched it and there was completed LOCKDOWN so I thought to give it a try.Even the first episode was disaster. The actors were not giving 100% dedication to their characters, I couldn't complete even the first episode. It was not going in proper direction.So this is only hype. I wonder how many less knowledgeable people are there across the globe. If you are used to watch classic series and movies, do not go for it.I REPEAT DO NOT GO FOR IT!!!

Review title: Logic holes, stupid characters and one witty heist
Review_body: OK, so I watched until the first episode of season 3, and then had to stop because it was just too much.The series starts of well, an interesting concept, your suspension of disbelief (regarding the tonnes and tonnes of paper money they somehow want to get out there, purely regarding the impracticability of it, and the fact that there are serial numbers on those bills, making them easily worth not a whole lot) helps get this going.However, each of the characters constantly gets themselves in a bad situation due to idiotic decision making and then the consequences they would so desperately deserve they don't face.I don't know what the writers of this show were thinking with their stand-offs, people cocking their guns left and right, someone faces a gun from someone else, so of course this person just draws their gun, too. What even hold the gun up for, if you aren't shooting the person who you're threatening, when they are drawing their own weapon? Ridiculous.The police acts idiotic and amateurish, unrealistic gun battles do not end in deserving deaths for the perpetrators, but are a cheap means to (try and) generate tension.I give the show credits for keeping me hooked regarding how exactly everything (the heist) turns out, even though you kind of know what is happening.In conclusion: suspend your disbelief as much as you can, and you are left with a middling show with an interesting premise and silly characters.

Season 5 was a biggest mistake!Huge disappointment!Tom and Jerry is more realistic!We can definitely see that the purpose was making more money!There is no more real emotion at the end!

Review title: Over hyped, over rated and over stretched mess with bad acting
Review_body: This show actually started of refreshing, season one being decent. Unfortunately the show continued on and on and on and on and........The velocity of story telling that at least covered the bad acting. Unfortunately the story telling slowed down more and more of the course of the run of this series.Season two and three could have been told in one season. Seasons four and five in half a season, but more later on the horribly bad Stallone style Rambo style non-story telling last part of this over stretched, over rated mess.Let's get on with the acting first and start with the worst excuse of an actor first; the professor, Alvaro Morte. The weakness of his performance is illustrative for the gliding scale of this show. His role got bigger, bigger and bigger over the course of the show. His underwhelming performance in terms of playing someone that actually has any form of intelligence, combined with his sack-of-mash potatoes charisma makes for a brilliant main character Netflix! Well done! Pedro Alonso, only decent actor in the whole show has a role for to small.Season 5:Let's keep the s-storm going and the money train going without delivering any quality content and stretch it as long as we can so a show that started decently will still attract more subscriptions but eventually will be remembered as the biggest flop ever. That seems like the one plan the director has had with this show, that's turning more into a C movies sequel. In the first half of season 5 we see the Rambo effect described above. In the first episode of the second episode season 5 we see Najwa Nimri whom just gave birth, out psychical the professor.Please stop this show and release me from ever having to see the same low quality performances from all these C,D,E, and F class actors. I've seen porn movies with a better story than this over moral, false sentiment show.

It's some of scenes didn't make any sense.
Really we are disappointed .

How can it be this series has such high ratings?It starts good but quite soon it drops to a very very long registration of the so called perfect heist which is everything but perfect... because....everyone is dumb as can be..The police, swat members, intelligence, you name it. And that goes that deep that it's impossible to see this show as a serious story telling drama.Acting is mediocre at best...Only 'Berlin' takes it away at times. The 'Professor' is really one of the worst character in the series.Not very sure why there's a season 3 in the making...

Review title: Nice TV show that sometimes makes you angry. 6-7/10
Review_body: I don't know if my impatience toward tv series in general will affect my review but I guess it will. Usually I don't like tv shows that are long especially when focused on one or few ideas and place! Like this show! The idea is nice and what they are trying to convey to the audience is interesting. But they keep repeating the same tactic like the thieves "revolutionists" are always a step ahead of the police when you think that they screwed up but you find that the professor thought of it too :O which became really stupid sometimes. Illogical. Some scenes and events are really silly and nonsense. Some characters are needles and some were really stupid like the big 2 guys. However, the show has some really amazing scenes. Would I recommend the show? Yes I would as a non-professional tv series with a catchy idea and an ending the audience will like, maybe love as I did! At least it's not too long hehe

Review title: Brutally fake boosted rating, dead serious on this!
Review_body: I wanted to like this so much. I crave for intelligent heist triller for a very, very long time and just the 1st few reviews and the score and i was hooked. To my surprise this is nothing more ,but intelligent heist WANNABE. Plot is flawed on so many levels , the actions and the choices our characters made one after another along with the insultingly dumb conversations at the most unpropriate times just made it unwatchable for me. I tried , i tried really hard to not pay much attention to small things just for the sake of the general entertainment ,but u couldnt do it and im sorry but i feel like i have to be drunk to stop noticing so many things. If you like t owatch smart movies with twists and really complicated intriguing plots do yourself a favour and skip it cause it will hurt your intellect! If like i could assume from some of the reviews u are nott much into this and i never seen anything good and similar plot wise .. u might try it but then again u only need to watch and listen carefuly and if u possess half the intelligence of a monkey u wont be entertained at all. I am sorry for my review but someone had to say the truth. AND NO it is not subjective , what is DUMB and unbelievable is DUMB and unbelievable sorry.

First of all, plot is good but execution, screenplay, acting, characterization etc utterly poor. Can't find some logic in there. I don't get, how this shows get so much ratings with such nonsense daily soap. Poorly done revision before exam. Netflix should have after stop after 2 season..

Review title: A Guilty Pleasure like Extra Cheese Pizza
Review_body:
Spoiler Free
Just finished watching the first 7 episode within a day ü§£ It is not a show for the purist. It is not a perfect show! But, is it still worth watching? Yes, for the entertainment. It keeps you on the edge, you want to know what is going to happen next. It is one of those guilty pleasures like Game of Thrones or eating an extra cheese pizza. It has its low. The background story of each character gets a bit boring. The writers need to define each character, agreed. But, we are in a middle of a Heist! I thought the tempo keeps dropping here and there. But, overall it has that feel good feeling. Bunch of losers dreaming to get rich buy committing a crime. Most of them come out as amateur robbers and are careless and casual, they don't look like professional going about their business with absolute focus barring their.... Hush! Do not want to give away any spoilers. If you can overlook the imperfections, it is surely a show worth watching. You will fall in love with the characters. Let me know who is your favorite!

Review title: Great idea, good acting, average creativity.
Review_body:
Well, usually when you watch these kind of movies, you start empathize all the parties, because if you are in this kind of situation you understand people need to act somehow to stay alive.
1. Arthuro was the weirdest persona, nobody could understand his role, although he kept creating a mess without being held responsible or at least to be tide up.
2. Nairobi keeps causing lots of trouble, which is definitely unrealistic; something like when they have to escape and there is a few minutes left, they are wondering around with the young guy.
3. Sometimes the group holds meetings, and at that point all the hostages are at the lobby without any surveillance, they could just press the button and open the door to go.
4. There to guards in front of the toilet door, and the hostages talking, using types, etc... and nobody notices.
5. The all movie is like puzzle, well thought although there small small stupid mistakes, that has nothing to do with the fact that "it is just a movie".There would be so many points to add up, however it is enough I guess. I stopped watching from the very beginning of the third season as I realized that because of that stupid young couple, something wired is about to happen.

Professor what are we robbing in season 3-4-5? Professor: People Will think we are robbing the bank of Spain, However wee are actually going to rob the viewers of their time, we will insult their intellect with every scene and episode, make them cringe and want to kill themselves with unnecessary gay drama, show them some of the most unrealistic action the world has seen. And that way we will rob them of their time. THE BIGGEST HEIST IN MANKID!!!!!
                
                    1,011 out of 1,356 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink

Review title: It should've ended a long time ago
Review_body:
I started watching this show before it came on Netflix. I really liked first 2 seasons (it was one season with 15 episodes actually).
It was suspenseful, well thought, thrilling.
It was nearly perfect.
But ever since Netflix got involved and audience became huge, the quality of the show downgraded. Finishing it after 2 seasons would've been perfect.
But no, they had to made more seasons to grab more money and "satisfy" the fans.
Well after finishing season 4 I am not satisfied at all.
So much plot-holes, unnecessary romance drama, flashbacks, irrealstic events...
And many characters became annoying to me.

Review title: The more you watch it, the worse it gets
Review_body:
First two seasons were great. Of course they had their own flaws but they were very entertaining, good written and made some sense.Seasons 3, 4 and 5 just ruined the show. Story is weak, characters not interesting at all, and they were acting stupid most of the times (making stupid choices). Some scenes were so unwatchable that made me think "Why am I still watching this show?" (like 5 people shooting at a guy from few meters distance and no-one hits him???). Also, scenes "from the past" where they show flashbacks from some previous heists were especially boring & painful to watch because one can tell they forced those scenes into the show just so that they could recast certain people.All in all -
Seasons 1 and 2 are 9.5/10 and I recommend watching just them.Seasons 3,4,5 are 2/10.

Review title: Part 4: A show with Great potential gets ruined.
Review_body: The show was created in Spain on May, 2017 and aired in Antena 3 then acquired by Netflix for global airing in the late 2017. After the massive success of first two parts Netflix invested more to make another season. Hence we got to watch part 3&4 about a new heist.We start this part from where we left it on part three; Nairobi shot to almost death, Lisbon caught and falsely executed to entrap Professor. Following which The Professor, filled with grudge and sorrow declaring this a war. So from a spectator's point of view it's a total mess, which we expected to recover this season.From the very first episode of part 4(The thumbnail of which is I guess "Inspired" by a very prominent picture/one of the many posters of Vertigo by Alfred Hitchcock which has absolutely nothing to do with story) we see that the healing of the mess has started with surgical procedure done to Nairobi, Professor as always managing his way out of the trouble and with them the story moves along.As like the first two/three parts of the show the acting, cinematography and editing stand out; on the contrary the quality of the script goes down only. The show was originally created by Alex pina, who overviewed the writing of the first two parts and some of the episodes of part three but the rest of part three and entire part four is mainly done by Ana Boyero, Luis Moya, Emilil Diez and several other writers.A major surgical procedure done just right by Tokyo with no professional to guide her, Palermo teaching an A grade assassin how to break free from a handcuff, Arturo harassing women at the midst of heist, messing up with military helicopter, a top grade police officer having tons of options in his hand just passing information to a known criminal, Alicia without even watching the CCTV footage finding out professor and most importantly no story development what so ever. These are some massive glitches in writing in this part of the show.To conclude, it's the same mess again; just like how we left it after part three and all we can do is wait for the next part to fix them up.

This is a TV-show that pretends to be smart. It starts with a cool idea, it introduce the story in an entertaining way but then face the burden of character development and story telling.This could have been an entertaining 5 episodes TV-show, instead it is a 15 episode mess followed by another season.The show is filled of plot holes and illogical reactions. It also use cliffhangers in the most infuriating way. Almost each episode ends with a dramatic situation that is defused instantly at the next episode start. It gives the feeling that nothing important ever happens. Worst, if feels like the show think the public is stupid and forgiving.On the other side the actors are doing very well and the direction is good too. The story is a total failure, I could not finish the two last episodes of season 1, even by skipping scene.

Review title: Worst tv series I have seen
Review_body:
This series got a high rating. So I thought let's check it out. My god how the hell people are even liking it! It is so overrated. Here are few points I picked up from first 7 episodes.
1) Professor makes the stealing looks like a heroic act. I mean how. They are not stealing but printing money, so what is that, charity!!!
2) The guys involved in the heist are so stupid. Two of them fell in love & now their love is more important than their mission. One father who spent most of his life in prison got panick attack knowing his son has murdered a hostage and almost compromised their mission. The son who is a 'hotshot' and used to 'bully people' fell in love with a hostage and could not kill her. (Yeah that's how the poor their writting is). It's nothing wrong for a criminal to have a heart but they have it too much, you will feel they are too good to be a criminal (but none of them are amateurs).
3) The police. They are the stupidest people I know. An inspector shares her mission information with her mother. She goes home & comes back like you are in a 9-5 job. She even dates during the mission. They let any people enter in their camp, no privacy at all. Even I could have fooled them.
Don't even talk about the acting and voice-overs. Apart from one or two people the acting is aweful. Please stay away from this show.

This movie is a MASTERPIECE. It has every characteristic of it: Good actors, great story, very funny, extremely emotional, you feel like jumping from joy, crying with them... Impossible to stop watching.
Must watch !

Review title: Was going great but fell apart in the last episodes
Review_body:
Let me start by saying that I was loving this series a lot until about episode 5 of part 2 (on the Netflix cut of the episodes). There were problems with the plot before that like, for example, how an entire police force be so inept ? But you can accept some of these because, hey, it's a movie. 
But when Raquel realizes her lover is the professor and decides not to arrest him, the whole credibility of the series falls apart. And then she sinks lower and lower in stupidity until the very end. All while the inept police force doesn't arrest her and she is not even prosecuted for her crime of lettting the robbers get away. 
Add to this the fact that Tokyo manages to escape and come back to the mint. Two quite impossible feats.
The insane gun fights in the mint near the end where, again, the professional police SWAT team can seem to hit half protected robbers with a single bullet.
And the ending which glorifies the criminal acts that these robbers made instead of putting them in jail were they belong.
So my rating went from 10 after part 1 to close to 0 at the end. But I still gave it a 6 overall because of the great first part and the fact that I might be affected negatively by the fact that they weren't arrrested.

Review title: Repeat a successful story doesn't always work!
Review_body:
Like previous reviews. Season 1 and 2 with actually was one season in my book, was great. Season3, 4 and 5 with also was shot as a continuous serie, So.. Season 2.. started out great but then it keeps repeating what makes the first season great. The problem is that if I wanted to rewatch season 1 I would have..Problem nr 2 was the side story with the --- one. It feel like they used him to fill out the story somehow, but it doesn't work. It would have worked as a spinoff, but it gives nothing to the main story.Problem 3. The main antihero is a psychopath. All good there, but when they later try to make us feel sorry for her? Its not working .. really... (sure, Dexter was a psychopath but he actually cared, or tried to, for the ppl around him) this woman is just not likable.)Problem 4. My favorite ---
Problem 5. The Corona probably f - kd up some of the production..So, season 1(1&2) get 9,5 stars. (7-10 stars on the individual episodes.)
Season 2 (3-5) get 5 stars overall. (3-7 stars on the individual episodes)--- = Dead, Dies!

They say that a drowning man clutches at a straw. This is, in a lot of ways, comparable to the behind the scenes journey of this failing Spanish saga. Netflix became the saviour of this once packed up two part series. The reason I am saying this is because it is clearly evident why it was failing in the first place. The direction is mediocre at best. The illogical thrill portrayed in the entire four parts is far from an art piece, it is instead comparable to Dwayne Johnson movie at best. The terribly designed filler intimate scenes can be described as Laboured. The use of logic in the screenplay is similar to the use of water in the running of an IC engine. The actors have a lot to work upon their skill in order to match the level of increasing fame they have received over the years. In the end it looks like Netflix played a big gamble by buying the show, and looks like it paid off!

Review title: Great idea and gripping for first 2 seasons...but season 3/4 dragged on
Review_body: The series was intriguing and very absorbing initially. The mind games between the police and Professor were exciting and wow-inducing. All the meticulous planning that they went through was amazing and kept you on the hooks.But the parts where they showed infighting between the thieves was way overdone. Everyone was pointing guns at everyone else, and completely botched the beauty and preciseness of the plan...and made the audience cringe.And Season 3 and 4 overdid all the internal discussions and interactions - there was much less time dedicated to the interaction between the police and thieves. If they could somehow edit out most of the non-heist related planning (example: the wedding scenes with Denver, and the stupid dialogues over lunch, etc), and the stupid infighting during the heist (round robin of "now I am in charge", Arturo scenes, the whole Gandia fighting), those seasons could also have been great.My recommendation to other viewers - do watch this series as this is probably the best of heist planning you will ever see (better than Mission Impossible movies). Just fast forward meaningless scenes showing personal interactions.

The events taking place inside the bank with the hostages and the "robbers" alongside the situations being handled by the Professor and the cops and intelligence outside the bank has created a masterpiece whose final outcome is still left to be revealed in the upcoming seasons.

Review title: Dont' listen to the American haters, this is a 10/10
Review_body:
The people who are giving this a bad review has probably never seen any movie or TV series in another language and probably watched this dubbed to english instead of just reading subtitles. Of course it will suck if you watch is dubbed, dubbed is for children who can't read so there you have that. They say it's a soap opera but it's not, it's a great heist series with loads of humor and romance, who doesn't like that? They are saying soap opera probably because it's in Spanish and no other reason than that. They say it has no logic or common sense but they are robbing the bank of Spain so yeah in real life that's not logical because it wouldn't happen but this is TV for gods sake and if someone were to rob the bank of Spain in real life, this is how they would do it so it has plenty of logic.
This is one of the best series I've ever seen and it baffles me that anyone would say bad things about it. It is completely original and you have never seen anything like it. I laughed a lot while watching this, I cried a lot, I was on edge a lot and couldn't stop watching it. I'm very happy they decided to make more season because I wanted more and more and more!
It is definitely worth to watch. A pure 10/10. I absolutely loved it.

Makes Too often too less Sense. A Genius put the worst criminals you can Imagine, to the worst team you can Imagine. A love story, sry 2 love storys or 3!?, this is for fans of Twilight or csi new York etc
