Review title: Perfect blend of suspense, thrill, emotion and drama.
Review_body:
LaCasa da Papel/Money Heist is one of the best shows out there. It's engaging from the minute you set in the first episode. The pacing of the show is just perfect. You won't feel even an episode wasted. All episodes are high on suspense always keeping you on the edge and will keep you hooked and longing for more.
Having a brilliant story and plot the main highlight of the show is it's characters. You'll have give it to the writers for writing such amazingingly flawed characters. The characters are layered and have amazing growth and arcs. You get so invested in the characters that you start feeling their laughs and their pain and you start rooting for them. You might even cry when one of them dies. And trust me the stakes are very high, they will die, even your favourite ones can.
The show has a unique way of story telling by parallelly showing current and flashback scenes which makes it even more engaging and makes the characters and their actions relatable. There are valid explanation behind all the big smart actions or plans which sometimes are little hard to buy but still serves the purpose.
The episodes are full of suspense and thrill and are high on emotions as well.
The show is extremely high on symbolism as well. How the Dali Mask, Red Colour and Resistance and of course bella ciao is used is extremely remarkable. It adds up even more layers to the story.
The cast is spot on and acting is decent.Overall its a must watch.
Totally binge-worthy.

The show really shines in the first few episodes, but after that quickly drowns in cheesy characters, senseless arguing and overall a very spanish soap opera feel.

Review title: How many plot holes can you fit into one story?
Review_body: Let me start by saying, I think like many others, I was duped into watching this by its high IMDB rating. And because of this series I am 100% convinced that Netflix is paying people to give this show a high rating. I understand that people's tastes vary, however, if you enjoy stories with countless plot holes, unlikable/irritating characters, bad acting, pointless monologues, and complete nonsense, then this is a must watch. In fact, the only reason I watched the whole series, was because of how ridiculous it was. It frequently sent me into fits of laughter.This did have the potential to be fairly interesting, yet it seems the writers went out of their way to produce complete nonsensical drivel. The story focuses on a group of supposedly highly experienced/intelligent robbers, who plan to take over The Royal Mint of Spain, in order to print and steal vast sums of money, over a two weeks period. Yet, this group of professionals couldn't be more incompetent. They spend five months prior to the robbery, in a boarding school style setting, run by an equally incompetent professor. Not only are they treated like children, but they also do a good job of acting like children. During the robbery, each of them take turns in making completely pointless mistakes, putting the entire heist in jeopardy. There are many boring monologues between the characters, which offer little substance. A good series would normally have at least one likeable character, either good or bad, where the audience can follow them on a journey and become engrossed in the story. Unfortunately there are no such characters existing in this series. The writers attempt to use the 'sex sells' approach throughout, hoping that the audience will be enticed by random cleavage shots, and hilarious sex scenes.The lead investigator/hostage negotiator was what really took the biscuit for me. Throughout the series she constantly makes wrong decisions, taking her lunch breaks in a nearby tapas bar, where at one point, she even drinks wine in the middle of her working day. This women is irrational, unstable, and appears to only care about getting laid. Not only has she had a 15 year affair with her closest colleague (who is married), but she also manages to bed the professor, after suspecting him of being in charge of the heist. The plot holes are really endless, and I could go on...If you enjoy watching high quality productions, then stay well clear of this. On the other hand, if you fancy watching laugh out loud rubbish then get stuck in!

La Casa de Papel is my favorite serie from Netflix. Congrats for all the good work.

Although the tv show had everything needed to succeed, the greediness of the producers and netflix make the series a really ''one of many'' out there.
Season 1 started surprisingly good and had everything needed for success: amazing plot, new actors, a different language, diversity, everything! And that's the reason it was amazingly succesful.
Season 2 was good enough, not as the first one but nice to watch.
Season 3 was the first sign that somebody tries to make money out of the dead horse. Plotholes, bad acting, people keep repeating phrases, irrelevant scenes...You could easily understand that something is going wrong.
As for season 4...? I think it was the final shot for the tv show. Even more irrelevant scenes, huge plotholes, people reacting and doing things with no reason...This is for everyone bothered to see this review. Start respecting your audience, don't treat them as money...Find out what your limits are!4 stars, because you had an amazingly good 1st and 2nd season...

Review title: Amazing show with too much romance
Review_body:
The plot twists throughout the show are really good because you may expect them but not in the way they happen. There are some characters like Tokio or Denver who can be really frustrating as their only focus are their love interests and that clouds their judgement and actions, especially Tokio's, to the point where it seems that she just doesn't care about anything else. Actions are too influenced by irrational feelings and that's why Berlin is one of my favorite characters because he's able to follow the plan and doesn't mess up too often or for stupid reasons. Nairobi is another favorite as she sticks to the plan, is tough when needed and is able to keep the gang together. The professor is incredible, even though his love affair with the inspector is a mess. The show really keeps you excited for what's going to happen next and it has great hidden messages and morals. La Casa de Papel is a nice show if you compare it to other very meh shows around right now!!
Cons: too much feelings and romance for a criminal show, hence characters behaving like amateurs sometimes.
Pros: lots of action, clever plot twists and well designed characters.

One of finest Series,all seasons has emotions, feeling, romantic, twists n turn. We strongly agree the lengthy episodes.

Review title: Overrated as hell, Seasons 3 and 4 (Part 2) not worth watching
Review_body:
Season 1 was pretty interesting. The characters invested me and I enjoyed seeing how the hostages and the criminals interacted with each other and how each criminal has a different backstory. But then it became a boring soap opera, and these so called "professional" criminals started doing the most stupid things possible to each other. Even the police showed utter incompetence at the simplest of actions. Are we supposed to like Tokyo? Everything she does is backed by no logic whatsoever and I could not stand any scene she was in. Seasons 3 and 4 were a huge step down. The fact that half of these characters agreed to another heist in Part 2 completely baffles me, and it just turned into a soap opera set in a bank. People are hyping up this show and my friend calls this the "Best show on Netflix" and I just don't understand it. It's strange how this show was translated into English as "Money Heist" but is actually a soap opera masquerading as a heist show.

Review title: Enjoyable till you start realizing how flawed it is
Review_body:
This was the first Spanish show I was watching and initially i got really hooked to it. 
What you expect from a heist show is the robbers showing a great amount of intelligence and planning to outwit the cops. Yes, there was a lot of planning involved and the main man behind it "The Professor" was a likeable character but slowly you start realizing that the cops and the intelligence team handling the operation have been shown so incompetent. The head of the cops team, Raquel Murillo is one of the lead cast in this show. But a few of her actions in the show might leave one surprised as to how foolish and ineffective the cops are. You start to wonder whether the heist is being successful because of the intellect of the con team or rather due to unprofessionalism of the cops.
Season 1 is still watchable but I thought that Season 2 was disastrous. Things that were happening defied logic and by the later half of the second season, the show was literally dragging. There are many loopholes in the logic and methods adapted by the police to stop the heist. 
I cant recall having watched any other show in this genre (except from the movie Oceans Eleven which i liked) but I would suggest giving this TV series a miss.

These guys call themselves revolutionaries, but all they did is to rob banks and live a luxurious life with the money they stole from state, Real REVOLUTIONARIES are people who put their life at risk for the opposed and poor, these guys are not revolutionaries, they are just murderers and bank robbers. And this show is just over glorification of crime and bank robbers

Review title: One of the best series ever recorded!
Review_body:
Dear all,If you're just reading and you just came to see reviews like I do most of the time to see if smth is worth watching, I can say this:
WORTH EVERY SECOND!
(consider me as not a fan of robbery movies and stuff and writing this)CAST IS AMAIZING! Scenario is dinamic and it stitches u to the TV, just PLEASE DO NOT RUIN everything with English audio!Don't know why people do that anyway.. In my opinion it's at least disrespectful to the language and actors that made a movie or series, especially in these days when you can find subs Anywhere... And if you cannot read.. Well that's a whole other bunch of issues...*makes it even harder for me to understand last fact since it's in Spanish (one of the most beautiful and known languages)üôÑ

If you're on adult, you'll start wondering about IMDb's excellent reviews of this very naive and complete nonsense series after episode 1. But then you notice the reviews are paid by Netflix, all phrasings very similar, no effort, all 10 points. The series would've had a lot of potential, interesting theme, BUT either this was made for teenagers or the creators have ignored one major fact: mastermind criminals who have been training for months aren't loose cannons after only 48 hours, having sex with everybody, dwelling on their personal problems, hostages don't develop a Stockholm syndrome in 48 hours, leading police detectives don't go for dates (with criminals!) during a massive hostage drama, and police officers don't turn into drunks and commit suicides in 48 hours. It's just so hilarious that all these people behave like the hostage drama had been going on for weeks and months. One of the funniest things is that the gang takes the eyeglasses of of of the police officers and installs a bug on the frame in front of the police officer, and he doesn't notice anything!! It doesn't help that everybody is overacting so much it hurts. I suppose this was meant as a comedy or a thriller for teenagers. I'm kind of angry that they ruined a good idea this way.

Don't watch after two parts otherwise you will be regret. They ruined everything in part 3&4.

Review title: Not quite a masterpiece but I'm so enthralled
Review_body: It's absolutely one of those series that forces you to take your laptop to the bathroom after 4-6 hours of non-stop binging only to return to your couch smelling like a sweaty bag of chicken feet.The underlying socialist philosophy and other subtle symbolism ring well in this one and are supported nicely amid a cast of talented actors, a near perfect plot, captivating cinematography, and sold character development that induces empathy for nearly every character presented in the show. Well, not to mention beautiful Spanish people who speak one of the sexiest languages in the world.Overall, the writing is simply superb with minor flaws which seem to be more abundant after the Netflix takeover. (In the 3rd season, there's more irrelevant social commentary dialogue that is seemingly due to America's obsessive PC culture)Finally, I will keep watching until its final part as the first two did such an extraordinary Job of building relationships with the main characters that I refuse to let go. Besides, I have to see if the Professor gets out alive and if Nairobi makes it out of the bank of Spain, right?PS. It has its flaws but the pros highly outweigh the cons.

It starts off great and then gets worse and worse.
The Professor is THAT almighty that the whole show is boring as hell. First I really thought - no joke - that this is a fan-fiction the Professor wrote about himself as he is absolutely flawless, knows everything, is allowed everywhere, seduces the most important woman in the show without problems (even it is said that he is completely helpless in those situations) It is so... frustrating and bad, it kills every suspension.Everything that happens always swings in favor of the criminals, mostly because of the Professor who resolves any problems within seconds and never, never, never gets any problems. He is always on the perfect spot for everything he wants to accomplish. And it aaaalways works out, it is so bad.But the most annoying thing is that this show really wants us to believe that the bad guys are the good ones. Women falling in love with them even they're risking other hostages lives. But lets not forget: They terrorized 67 people with great fear, giving them mental scars for live, forced a woman into sexslavery(!), risking health and mind of so many people. They threatened them, they put them in danger, they tortured them!
AND THEN - no joke - it takes one sentence(!) from Berlin in an Interview to bring ALL People around the world on their side? That is insulting for ALL people who ever were in such situations.
Those people would even make a show about a concentration camp in Nazi-Germany into an all funny-Nazi-Mess...

I simply don't know how some adults don't understand that a movie it's a movie....expecting facts 100% like in real life...wow...

Review title: 10 points for ruining an epic show
Review_body:
Why do producers never know when to stop? It's ok to admit you've run out of ideas. You gave us two epic seasons now let us rest in peace geez.Season 3 was forgiving, but season 4?!!!
This season was just a mass of irrelevant fillers that did absolutely nothing for the plot and action scenes that were so unrealistic. Not to mention the inconsistency in the characters? Cliche relationship dramas to kill time, a military assassin that somehow couldn't figure out how to get out of hand cuffs but was able to dodge 100 bullets fired in open air, the professor and Lisbon brought absolutely nothing to the table until the last 30 minutes, Nairobi died twice for audience reaction, and the transgender who was introduced took no part in anything.
An insult to fans honestly.

Spoiler Warning.If Netflix acquiring the rights of La Casa de Papel and disintegrating the season 1 into two seasons and re-releasing them wasn't bad enough , they made season 3 and 4 without a proper storyline. With dumb logics , a heist is still in the running , fine and smooth over two seasons. From Tokyo starting to wage a war to get back Rio and dumping him later to Arturo drugging women to take their advantages as a hostage himself is just ridiculous.Palermo releasing Gandia with a dislocated thumb and yet the most overpowered character in that condition.Dead Berlin doesn't have a much to do yet he is seen just for audience pleasure.Same ways, predictable plots and dumb logic like how an entire nation doesn't know their army birds all just makes Money Heist a cliche of La Casa e Papel.Although some great soundtracks like the Gravita and some brilliant acting by the cast and Alvaro Morte and Rodrigo de la Sarna should be lauded.
All in all this is another one of Netflix spoiling a series for the sake of profit given the hype it had generated.

Review title: all characters play this role by hearts
Review_body:
A spanish television series which gained world wide popularity. After that Netflix acquired global streaming rights. It is full of drama,thrill,romance. The series is full of mind games and fine strategies. The series received several awards. There is 2 parts which is of 8 episodes each in first season which is about robbery of The Royal Mint of Spain.In the first look of this robbery gang we assume that they are robbers but after sometime they will actually become heroes. There are some situation where you must cry. Police Or government did several things wrong to them but they did nothing wrong even having so much guns etc they used those but no one killed by them. For so many reasons of heroic things they become idols and get support from public.Now comming to each character of money heist starting with then robbers-
1. Tokyo- she is strong enough to handle any situation but innermost she is also emotional.2. Nairobi- she is most caring person in the gang she can understand everyone from any gang members to any hostages.3. Moscow- a lovely character we can see in him. Also a lovely father he is.4. Rio- first of all he has a lovely smile, anyone fall in love with this smile. He has super knowledge about technology. Also boyfriend of Tokyo.5. Denver- another very touching character and touching smile he has. üòÇ son of Moscow, relationship between father and son is heart touching.6 & 7. Helsinki- a big man but soft hearted. He is with his brother, Oslo in this series. Brother was died in season 1.8. Berlin- last but top most character is Berlin of the gang, he has a cool mind to execute all situation. He is a fighter through out the season 1.Now comming to the other characters-
1. Inspector - who is doing her job but there is something "In the end love is a good reason to everything fall apart".2. Monica- secretary of director of Royal mint of Spain. In heist he and Denver fall in love.3. Arturo- Director of Royal mint and was boyfriend of Monica. People love this character so he is returned to the next season also.Now comming to the main character,
Professor- he mastermind of the plan and organise the plan so finely. He fall in love with inspector. He planned everything so preciously that ultimately won over all bad situation. He came with a epic twist in every time when needed.I must say there are some quotes in this series that actually meant a lot. One of them -
"When someone is in love, they look through rose-tinted glasses. Everything's wonderful. They transform into a soft teddy bear that's smiling all the time."
I'm not telling the story. I'm just giving a touch of this series so who are not watched till now I suggest watch the series in this lockdown time and after one season you automatically watch next season's parts without any influence."Una mattina mi sono alzato
O bella ciao, bella ciao, bella ciao, ciao, ciao
Una mattina mi sono azalto
E ho trovato l'invasor"

The season 4 really changes the entire dynamics of the plot! There are so many surprises and the way things turn out till the end is delightful to watch. Waiting eagerly for Season 5!!! Bella Ciao!

(I only could watch the first season, everything written is only applies for that)Money Heist could be a good piece, if they make it a movie series, or a short series.The base story is good, but it doesn't have enough content to fill up a whole series so they decided to go the path where they write stupid twists and conflicts to make up the screen time.Some characters are out of place, annoying kids who doesn't contribute anything to the heists succes, no way any masterplan would involve them. Any storng-enough individual could learn using powertools in five months, why would bring an older man just for that?The small thing that bothers me most is the CSi syndrome, where they want to show their technology as fantastic, way too advanced. They do impossible things most of the time. This applies to logic too, the police every time assumes everything right from the smallest information drop. "Blurry image? Enhance. There is a face. We know everything about them now." and so on.TLDR: Bad writing, bad directing, bad characters and (maybe) bad acting.Why it got the 3 stars:
The picture is very good. The camerawork, the lighting, the props, the clothing, the locations/sets (except the abandoned road felt out of place/"cheap" at the heist's beginning) and the sound is flawless.Way to watch: The english dub ridiculous, set the language to original and the subtitles to english (cc).Based on the other reviews, which say that the first two seasons was the better, I DO NOT RECOMMEND watching Money Heist to anyone like me, who demands logic in a story. Do yourself a favour and save those hours for something worthy.

Review title: My review of the Money Heist -- Is it a series worth watching? Absolutely. Is it relevant? Sufficiently.
Review_body: La casa da papel, or known by its English name Money Heist, has been impossible to miss, with red jumpsuits and Dal√≠ masks popping up everywhere on social media. It's not surprising then, that it became the most-watched non-English show on Netflix.Initially, I was sceptical of the show. Would it be just another heist series with a predictable plan and some expected characters? But it turned out to be a little more than that for the creators took a classic heist story and redefined it completely. Yes, there were expected characters but with many unexpected turns to them. The 'Professor' crafted a masterplan not for robbing a bank, but for printing their own money inside Spain's Royal Mint.It is a quintessential Spanish drama. Rather than the cool, organised and technology-based drama you would expect from let's say, British shows, here, the focus is on the minds and the hearts. It's all about the meticulous planning that has gone behind the heist. To put it simply, it is more passionate and more human.But what made me love the show was the political theme running not-so-subtly alongside the main narrative. The robbers call themselves the revolution and their red jumpsuits are a clear choice drawn from socialist colours portraying blood and struggle. Even the Dal√≠ masks are not a random choice for Dal√≠ was known to express anti-capitalist sentiments in many artworks. The catchy song, Bella Ciao is a borrowed anthem from Italian protests and the corruption and hypocrisy of government organisations are targeted over and over again throughout the four seasons.Yes, I agree that the fourth season was not as thrilling, as exhilarating and as entertaining as the first two seasons. If you really just want a quick watch, you can stop after the second season because the second heist seems like a hollow imitation of the first. We miss Berlin even more when he's replaced by his weak replica, Palermo. The Professor loses his charm every time he's defeated by the police and the heist itself seems to be lacking in motive. But if you've been close to the characters like I have, you'll understand that this is not the characters growing weaker-they're simply changing and characters don't always evolve to be stronger versions of themselves but sometimes, just more real ones.Is it a series worth watching? Absolutely. Is it relevant? Sufficiently. At a time when we are witnessing anti-system protests all over the world and in India, and at a time when these protests seem more necessary than ever before, these revolutionary characters are much more likeable than heartthrobs in rom-coms. If nothing else, you'll end up cheering for the revolution to win and perhaps, longing for a cool, city name for yourself.

Netflix really destroyed the show.I cannot give it 10 stars anymore. So I will give it 1 only so they understand their huge mistake.

Review title: An overrated show with annoying characters
Review_body: Sure, the idea of the show is smart and entertaining: a bunch of elite criminals working together to rob billions of dollars. Some of the characters such as Berlin are professional and smart, which is good for the plot. It could have been a great series. But the show went downhill after Tokyo's relation with Rio is introduced. Their love is not reasonable at all and Tokyo kept using love as an excuse to ruin the plan of the entire team, putting everyone in danger but did not pay for her mistakes. Besides, there are just so many plot holes in the show that I don't want to spoil here. The police are unbelievably dumb and useless as they dealt with the criminals in stupid and inefficient ways. Many of the characters in the show does not help develop the plot but just annoy the audience so much, one of them being Tokyo who is so immature and arrogant which kept bringing trouble to the whole team. The actions of some characters are brainless and the show simply doesn't deserve such a positive rating. I would have given it a better rating if not for the vexing characters and plot holes. The show is polluted by undeveloped and sudden emotions and love between the characters.

Review title: The most stupid Spanish Police and Superheros
Review_body: Very frustrating movie, following typical unrealistic storyline. Robbers have superhero strengths, all planned out, professor who is a martial arts ninja while the police is led by the most stupid and unprofessional inspector ever seen. She never is at the site of the robbery, only deals with personal problems, does everything on her own and is a cry baby. In real life, nobody would give such a person the responsability of chief inspector. Finally when she catches the professor and he walks away, why she doesnt shoot him in the foot. The actors playing Tokio and Nairobi are not bad but the storyline sucks. Police wouldnt stay on stand by if kidnappers behave so strange, dont have any demands, deal with explosives, start shootings with the police, let the dictators set all terms, and hostages start disappearing. Also hostages working that happily for the robbers while treated like dogs is not realistic. Also the idea that the public supports and has sympathy for the robbers is a lame idea. Its hard to watch but this movie sucks big time. Worst actor: The inspector Raquel.

This show is an unrivaled masterpiece. I want to give it a 12/10. I found it on a complete whim and was drawn in immediately. I want more and more and more of this, please.

Loved watching first few episodes, and then! Such a unreal storyline.
People fall madly in love in 5 days.. willing to go to any lengths for love, including a police officer.Civilians can fire guns like pros ( Monica)The police can never hit a target but the robbers are prosThe list goes on and on.

Review title: Season 3 was laughable 4th went beyond ludicrous
Review_body: I (regrettably) watched the entire series, all four seasons! I now look back and wonder, why oh why did I did this to myself? The fourth season was totally disrespectful to the audience. My 7 year old daughter would have written a better script. Almost zero progress in an entire season, pointless and endless flashbacks. OK guys, we all liked Berlin but you decided to kills him, get over it, you can't bring him back in every episode to capitalise on his popularity.Third season was mediocre at best and then season four happened! Oh dear, what a comedy! Naked Gun at its best! Hostages that rape other hostages, transexuals trying to create plot twists (unsuccessfully), a moron (Rio) who allow a guy with skills of Rambo, Chuck Norris, Bruce Willis and Arnold Swargeneger combined to walk into a panic room that could also serve as weapon depository for a small army unit! And then we go beyond that to Avengers universe! Yes, you can see a single guy avoiding hundreds of bullets shot from 5 meters! Wait, it gets even better: He is killing a character that we spent three episodes to save and he allows a psychopath sex addict with narcissist syndrom to remove foreign objects from a grenade from his body...I won't continue watching it

A great watch! Full of surprises, nail-biting suspenses and great acting by the actors made this series one of the bests that I have ever watched. Don't wait anymore and start watching!

I was literally blown up by this serie. In two days, I saw all the episodes of S1 & S2 and I'm getting ready for a S3 marathon.
The development of the characters, the music and atmosphere, the messages.. all these elements have created one of the best series I've ever seen on tv.
I liked the psychological close-ups and back & forths, that allowed me a deeper dive to characters, I liked how the honesty and the ambiguous nature of humans were portrayed on controversial characters, (Berlin=the machist/ethic hero, Arturito= the convencional honest/dishonest want-to-be hero, Helsinki= the loyal-unti-the-end hero, Tokyo= the unpredictable atomic bomb of the gang with her emotional wake up moments, Ariadna= the frightened want-my-life-and-your money lover of Berlin that stood by him until his end as promised, etc)All the characters, beautifully painted make a unique mosaic, a colourful kaleidoscope, an emotional rollercoaster, where the mainstream perception of good/bad loses its density, and values as: honesty, integrity, loyalty and love are brilliantly enlightened,

What started as a critic of capitalist system ended being a part of it. My rating for first two seasons would be 8/10 but with the new seasons this is anything but a good show.

Review title: So Many Things Wrong with the Plot!
Review_body:
Season 1 was good and somehow plausible, but I pushed myself to finish season 2; and I'm absolutely not going to watch the rest as the writer/writers insult their audience by considering them gullible and/or action-junkie imbeciles! The following is just a few instances of what's wrong with the series:1. Abusing the song Bella Ciao to glorify a bunch of murderers and criminals as heros! Partisans fought for their country, its people and freedom, they didn't fight for their personal gain/money, they didn't take innocent people as hostages and mentally (and quite often in the series, physically) torture them!
2. Raquel was supposed to be the best chief of police in Spain and yet she was too stupid to take the guy somewhere out of the town to interrogate rather than arresting him right away! She was also too weak of a character to shoot him when she was given a second chance -in the legs, for instance- and let him drive off in her own car!
3. Angel lost his faith in the system in just less than 5 minutes? Monica risked her own and others' only chance of freedom over a stupid crush? What was the significance of the scene Nairobi boosting Alison's confidence when she was a passive hostage throughout S1&2 and not showing any courage? Was that merely a filler, like many other unnecessary scenes?
4. Is the Spanish police force this incompetent, for real?! They couldn't shoot Tokyo's motorcycle all the way she was driving through!
5. The police had several opportunities to infiltrate through the ceiling without breaking a glass or making any noise (e.g. cutting the glass at night like in Mission Impossible movies); even during multiple occasions of noisy exchanges and events when the heisters were distracted! 2-3 rangers could take down 5 criminals, especially if finished them quietly and separately (as they were scattered across the place most often), given that Oslo and Moscow were down, or when Oslo was gone and Tokyo under their custody.
Moreover, the characters are not charismatic and definitely not loveable! Do the writers seriously expect people to root for/relate to any of them?

Review title: Had potential but was unbearable to watch
Review_body: Money heist had a good first episode filled with a potential good story, good character introduction, good acting, great visuals but left a bad taste in my mouth because of the ending of the episode when the female lead character took matters into her own hands and compromised the plan because of her lover who is also with her all while she is being introduced to the viewer as someone who just a few days back lost the love of her life in a heist. In the same episode? The romance felt forced and rushed. Then in the second episode. It turns out that her lover didn't get shot and she compromised the whole thing because of someone she just met and he didn't even get shot. Damn that's stupid. But thankfully she didn't compromised the plan very much cause she can't aim while being a professional. Next on, the forced couple fights while a hostage seizes the opportunity to take her phone not to call someone but to delete a nude. Yeah right, to delete a nude while being taken hostage. Anyways through plot magic the police hacks in these milliseconds her phone camera and has a livefeed from the room and catches the main female leads lover while he rushed to grab the hostages phone. The police finds out who he is. And the plan gets more compromised. In episode three, the mastermind behind the plan orders to find the phone from which a colleague got identified. The main female leads lover eventually confessed that he himself was to blame. And his colleagues rightfully beat him up because it's the second time he and his forced love with main female lead compromised the plan. Then the, in my opinion, maniac and not at all professional main female lead takes matters into her own hands again and shoots the cameras which serve the actual mastermind of the operation. Because she is a PROFESSIONAL. That's when I stopped watching.And don't get me wrong. I like that their plan is kinda failing. But three episodes all because of a stupid wild and possibly dementia(she had the love of her life in episode one killed) suffering main female lead is kinda enough. Especially since I know the creators intention was to create a fearsome and cool main female lead and it backfired in the most laughable way. It got me thinking that it is perhaps created for teen girls and should not be regarded as a serious tv show. If that is the case I change my rating to 6.It's just a pitty cause the series in other aspects really promised.

This is byfar the best show ever on netflix. If u havent watched this series yet, believe me it is worth all the hype. U will get hooked to this as soon as u watch the first episode. Only few series can make this in their first episode itself (like prison break, breaking bad, stranger things).

The season 4 of money heist starts off with high intensity, after launching missiles to the police where they picked up from the previous season, successfully operating on Nairobi without a surgeon in sight. Then it goes slow, until episode 6 where they amp the energy and release a series of bombastic events. The most shocking of all would be the death of Nairobi. We shouldn't have gotten our hopes up from the trailer when we saw Helsinki tearfully playing a morbid tune on his harmonica. But nonetheless as she survives the surgery all hopes were up, until Ganda shoots her in the head after beating up her fresh surgical wounds and shooting her in the hand. Overall it's a great watch but they could've given her death a little more dignity.

All I can say - what a waste of money by Netflix. The only reason why I watched all four seasons is because there is literally nothing else to watch on Netflix. And the only thing I liked about this show is the visuals. Which makes me sad to see all these money wastedon a ridiculously dumb show.This show is so dumb that it makes it obvious that all positive reviews are fake. Because writing an online review requires at least a spark of human intelligence. And anyone with even a slightest spark of intelligence would be able to see how insanely dumb this show is.First, all main characters are extremely unlikable. I was literally screaming for them to die any time they had a chance. And on two rare occasions when I started to feel some partial sympathy with a character, he (not she!) inevitably dies as if any signs of intelligence were not allowed on this show.The plot is completely unrealistic, not in terms of the big idea, which is quite intriguing actually, but in details of execution. I like shows that are believable, and this one would definitely not win any points on intelligence, but I think I made it clear already.And finally, I found it very disturbing how criminals who's actions were nothing but selfish through all four seasons were portrayed as some sort of revolutionary heroes. They are not even robbing private banks, they are robbing public institutions established to ensure stability of national currency in the interests of general public. How debasing national currency by printing billions of cash banknotes or stealing the entire national gold reserve is in the best interests of the nation? It is just mind boggling, I cannot remember any show with a more ridiculous message than this.

Review title: Up for binge watching? You have reached the right place
Review_body:
It was recommended to me by so many of my friends. So I started watching Money Heist! I have always loved suspense thrillers but for me Money has turned out to be the best of all! Thanks to Netflix for blessing with such a world class content.It's a beautifully written story that will keep you hooked for 4 seasons. You are lucky if you haven't watched this because they have just released part 4 and it was almost an year's wait for it but trust me every minute is worth watching.I am sure at the end of s4 you will be like "just give us the season 5 already". It's. a perfect blend of ingenious planning, careful detailing, thinking about very minute points(that has impressed me a lot) and ofcourse the depth these characters portray.The professor is the best chatacter of all and I am sure there are many reasons to it but mainly his calm and composed behaviour.Berlin is highly missed inside the Bank of the spain! He would have lead yet another perfect yet slightly messy heist.Nairobi will be terribly missed. I don't know why it happened but it turns out that the Berlin's death resulted into a Chaotic leadership inside the heist and that's why they have just left us to the past memories of the Berlin.If you watch Money heist in English, I am sure you will fall in love with Berlin's voice!
Contained, beautiful, insightful, a little bit on the masculine side yet elegant.Spoiler: It starts to get a little messy in S3 but s4 turns depicts almost complete mess in their plan but that's how they connect with real life so well!
It's a like chess game , you might play your moves but opponent has got his own, and it might leave your burned for a while or may be even make you go downhill. I actually liked where things started falling apart naturally because it would be a bad set up if professor knows everything beforehand and the show would be too predictive. Although, It's the Professor, who has made us believe in that.S4 ends on a perfect cliffhanger and I cannot wait to unfold what's there inside in Season 5.Till then, Bella Ciao, Bella Ciao!

Review title: Dont know what the viewer's are crazy about.
Review_body:
Hard to see such a top rated series being so mediocre in its content.
There seems to be no logic in the sequence of events. The chief inspector does a nice 9-6 Job, not bothered about the hostages. Goes home nicely when she feels tired , dates her so called boyfriend.
I really like the part played by hostages. They enjoy themselves being in captivity. No one bothered to break free. Thought they make some attempts , but ultimately enjoy themselves being called hostages.
Also the robbers have their nice Team meeting every now and then , without being bothered about the hostages that they may run or hurt any of them. Liked the trust factor that was built betweent the two parties.
And lastly they buillt a nice tunnel between the Royal Mint and the professors house. The distance seemed to be less than 5 meters.
EXCELLENT JOB REVIEWING AUDIENCE!!!

Review title: Good basic idea and some style. But irritatingly low grade stuff, bad direction and barring few average acting
Review_body:
The basic idea of holding mint with hostage was fine and some excitement generated at times and some style. But that's it !!! A low grade stuff besides thatBad direction and complete lack of attention to details. Just some examples:1. Flaw in philosophy: The group is shown as quite innocent who only steals with the justification that big banks steal too. With professor trying to kill inspector's mother, the inspector coming out of coma and group shooting recklessly on police who is doing their job, and then keeping simple people hostage, where is that innocence??2. Technical Flaws:
Biggest one: While the professor is so super intelligent, police seems to be utter stupid that knowing such a big some of money is being stolen, police doesn't have any helicopter on stand-by, nor they lock down the city knowing group is exiting,main inspector taking her boyfriend to crime scene and within the barricaded areamain inspector dating around in an intense operation of 5 daysthe group seems to have everything inside the factory: plush sofas, coffins, candles to decorate the deadhow the hell did they leave the city and the country is never shown with police knowing they are on the run (I guess somehow one has to assume with the great brilliance of the professor, they had a way and the police is anyway stupid)In open firing inside the mint which is happening in an aisle of say 3 meter width, while commandos have shield (and hoping they are experts in encounter) and the group doesn't, not even a single heist member is injured !!!!! Are you kidding me?3. Ridiculous acting and presentation of main characters:
The main inspector in charge of such a big operation shown to be highly unprofessional, weak in character and stupid to take on the criminal alone every timeMost of the gang which is supposedly from not so well off background, has great personality, attitude, drink and eat like they have been taught etiquette, even snobbishness at timesAnd now the funny part: The main inspector being a clear suspect in being accomplice, somehow lives on the life peacefully with no investigation or charges brought on and then leaves the country to Philippines !!!!

Review title: The Most Over-hyped Series of Streaming Content to Date
Review_body: (I couldn't get through season 2) Unpopular Opinion: Money Heist/La Casa de Papel is the most overrated waste-of-time series on Netflix (and perhaps streaming syndicates to date). Just a few reasons: over the top melodrama with psychotic 'love' stories that drown the plot; main characters that are cliche and all but impossible to sympathize with, unoriginal soundtracking borrowed from American Beauty and only 1/3 of the cast is comprised of decent acting. Most of all it is WAY too long in telling the story that needs to be told. Apparently it is being positively compared to Breaking Bad. Wow. Money Heist doesn't even come close to seeing the dirt on the bottom of Breaking Bad's feet it's buried so far beneath it. One thing I will say is the public interest it has generated in foreign production is a plus. We need more exposure to foreign film. But sorry not sorry, you can't remotely compare it to works of art like Breaking Bad. Someone please tell me how Money Heist/La Casa de Papel has a claimed a 4.8 on google, an 8.5 on IMDB and a 91% on RT. Then again, the live action version of Aladdin also got rave reviews from the general audience. Maybe as a society we are just becoming that simple/easy to please.Series that are actually worth a watch: Barry, Chernobyl, BoJack Horseman, Succession, Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul, Schitt's Creek, Fleabag, Dirty Money, Killing Eve, The OA, Russian Doll, When They See Us, It's Bruno!, Bodyguard, The Americans, Westworld.

Review title: Passion and Action Wins the Race
Review_body: While the show started as a Spanish staple, it made it to the International screens in no time and gathered a fanbase as loyal and dedicated as that of the big names such as Breaking Bad and GOT. Though I'll surely refrain from comparing it with the likes of the afore mentioned masterpieces, it'll be unjust to praise this one for its intelligently knit web of events and outcome. With heist movies and tv series making rounds in our To Watch List, the audience too have developed a knack of their own to determine what happens next. Money Heist strips us clean of that because it crushes our every anticipated move; atleast the first two seasons does. But as we spend more time with our beloved burglars, we learn to see through their characters- strengths and weaknesses, and once the very facet of unpredictability that made the show such a hit begins, turns it into what it shouldn't have been- slow and predictable. While the fourth season surely succeeds in picking up the pace, we are left wanting for more of that adrenaline rush and Professor's meticulous understanding of the art of a heist. But at the end of the day, Money Heist's biggest achievement will be to have millions of viewers sympathizing and rooting for the ones who are supposed to be the bad guys and hoping for a heist to become successful. Therefore, the series might not have achieved perfection, but surely it isn't one to be ignored.

Review title: Entertaining but before watching you need to keep your logic out of your head
Review_body: Like everything in this generation, I discovered this TV show through hype. It was going viral, on my Netflix home screen, on twitter, everywhere. So, I decided to give it a try. I feel disappointed I wasted my time on this show. I'm not a fan of fantasy shows like Spiderman, Superman, Batman etc. Honey Heist is a mirror image of super hero movies, difference being the crew here is a bunch of bad guys. I'm not a fan of fantasy shows because of the imbalance, one side is extremely strong, smart, has all the powers available right on time and other side is simply dumb. In this show too, it's the same, the cops are dumb and incompetent. The cops in this show have all the equipment, fancy gears, intelligence power, yet they screw up worse than a third world country cops, not once but multiple times, come on, are the Spanish cops really that bad? Could the makers not make is somewhat believable? The Royal Mint of Spain is under siege and the top cop is going on a dinner date? Having an affair with the main accused? Oh my, that is some level of soap opera right there. And to top it off they dragged what could have been a mini-series to 4 seasons. Learned my lesson, don't jump on the hype wagon, do your research before wasting time on something like this again.

Honestly, I have never been so addicted to a TV show like this one! From the beginning to the great finale in season 2! And then? Season three and four all the time it is only "up and down like a rollercaster" you never know what is coming! Can't understand how can anoyone be upset about it?!

Review title: Soap Opera Heist weekdays after "The View"! There I fixed it for you!
Review_body: The real heist is by the writers who keep stalling for more time with more nonsense episodes while Netflix prints money.First season had promise. But shortly into the season characters start making flatout preternatural connections especially inspector Raquel. Which she corrects by missing the most obvious ones. 6 episodes in... coming out of a hazy binge stupor because your wife keeps pressing next... you realize... wait... they expect us to believe all this happens in 3 days. People recover from gunshot wounds as if they were scratches. Of course, everyone forgives and forgets. Love stories happen when someones sneezes. Investigations are mobilized across all of Spain with such immediacy and the realtime forensics of our dreams. Then the typical "we have the all important lab results - i knew he was the guy - but your voicemail is now full - and I'm the jaded drunk lover about to have an accident/coma routine - let me call your selectively Alzheimers mother." If only his twin would show up.... Professor Palpatine's plan then everything would be proceeding as he's forseen. If we still had TV guide this show would be on at 11 am after "the View." I got fooled because they didn't shoot it in live camera format with dramatic face to face pauses, watery eyes, and breakaways to commercial (remember those). Music is pretty good. I can go on... but then I would be an accomplice perpetuating the real crime of taking your time with this show (like the writers!)Watch no more than two episodes to get the gist/hype then make your escape!

Review title: WHAT are you all talking about???
Review_body: Firstly.... do not watch this series in dubbed English, its horrible... watch the subtitlesSecondly, i consider myself to be bit of a critical sort, when it comes to TV shows and i am very rarely impressed, especially by anything that isn't a documentary. However this show is incredible, it is clever, well thought out, incredibly well acted and produced that i cannot understand where reviews of 1 stars are coming from?!?If i had listened to these reviews, i would never have enjoyed the absolutely brilliant series that this is.DO NOT listen to 1-3 star reviews, they are totally unrealistic, over opinionated by people who i can only assume watched it dubbed whilst tapping away on their phones. Just don't watch it dubbed, as it does do your head in.

But, unfortunately, there are too many incidents even for an average viewer that do not apply even to the logic of the setting of the show itself. A plot can be unrealistic, impossible, illogical, or not at all satisfying your common sense. Yet, we may love watching a movie or a show for the sake of the environment it offers because we as viewers mould ourselves to fit into it, into the structure it expects us to. That is the reason we enjoy most action movies, crime thrillers, horror movies etc. However, Money Heist is a contradiction. It has a story line that could have been great, if it appealed to the same mould it wanted the audience to get into. The characters are chosen by the professor based on their great skills, but mostly they turn out to be picked randomly from the streets, considering their common sense. The plan for the heist has been going for years, and another five months of planning the action as a team, with a tunnel already miraculously built under the mint, we dont know how, and each and every incidental and psychological progress meticulously calculated. However, the series does not seem to stick to the logic even it has structured the audience to get into. Once, you are the cleverest person on earth, next, the dumbest. You are negotiating with the robbers in one scene, and the next, you are chatting with strangers in a cafe discussing the heist. As a pregnant hostage, you have your lover with you, and then you also have sex with one of the robbers! You are watching each and every movement at the crime scene, and have to be in touch with them, but at the same time have to do other chores every now and then for hours, leaving your place of work! So, so many irritating scenes that make you ask so many whys . The cleverest lot turn out to be the dumbest lot on many occasions . The character traits of the lot have never been considered by the professor, the cleverest of all, while recruiting them. I started watching it because of the rating, but was folled by it, so went on fast forwarding because skipping did not mean missing anything important, except some nonsense. And I gave after season 2. 1

It never seems to bore you. Maybe giving you about 31.5 hours (upto S02 ) of sitting at the thorn in the curiosity. Must watch and enjoy..

Nairobi: Alba Flores
Tokyo: Silene Oliveira
Berlin: Pedro Alonso
Rio: Miguel Hirron

Review title: Three reasons to watch Money Heist
Review_body:
Money Heist is a Spanish heist crime drama television series. The series was initially intended as a limited series to be told in two parts. Then, Netflix acquired its global streaming rights and divide it into several episodes. It currently has four parts on the Netflix platform. The plot talked about the heist events which were held by some guys, who took a female, Tokyo, as a leader and learned the heist skills by a professor. In sum, the series is attracting, touch and thought-provoking to me.
The reason why it is attracting is that in a normal condition, the criminal movies tell people the crimes and robber are always wrong, we must learn the sense of justice. However, at this one, the plots of it make people support them to success to heist at the same time.
Some of touching parts makes me so impressed. Although the robbers are from different background at the beginning, the only thing they had in common is that they were all convicts before. They all did not know each other at first, nevertheless, owing to the cooperation during the robbing, they start to build up the family-like relationships; even one of the actor, who is my favorite in this film, Berlin, sacrifices his life to save everyone escaping the bank. The scarification of the actor I love the most is literally toughing me a lot.
Despite there are some sad parts in this series the series is always thought-provoking to viewers. After watching the four series, I am always pondering the implication the director who wants to express; for instance, the theme song of it is a Italian song, ''Bella chia'', describe the mood of the warriors in the war at the battle field.

Why kill so pretty girl she deserved better. I want her back! NOW

If you are an action-crime movie fan, this series will suit you the best!I coincidentally watched this series a couple of months ago, and I literally can't stop watching all the seasons again and again. The storyline is incredible. There are a lot of twists and turns, which keep the series exciting. I think each character in the story is so cool and kinda unique as well. The casts had worked hard at the rate that I can feel it from their excellent acting skill. I fell in love with all characters, no matter how evil they are. They all have compelling backgrounds. I know that sometimes their actions and thoughts are annoying. But please, don't forget that they are humans. They can't be perfect. They can make the most stupid mistakes. That's why I don't understand why people keep blaming Tokyo (the lead female character) and giving the low rating of this series. I feel like the director created all the characters in the most reasonable and relatable way. I just love all of them.This Spanish tv-series is phenomenal. The red jumpsuit and Dali mask are iconic. It became the signs of rebellion against the system. I really really love it! Everything in this story, for me, is such a masterpiece. The series keeps me watching it addictively because it is so suspenseful and unpredictable. One little action of a character can bring great disaster to the whole episode, or it can be the best decision ever.I've been searching for a series that can excite me all the way to the end and I found this. I binge-watched the whole seasons in just 1 week and watch it again in the week after. You better binge-watch it before Netflix take it off!

In the entire season I could feel the writer or the screen writer has managed to create the suspense at the end of every episode but during the entire episode the thing which I really hate was the character called Tokyo because she was always showing herself to be too busy but in actual she was just too hothead who wasn't knowing anything and also in the starting itself the plan got ruined thanks to Tokyo but on the other hand the other girl In the team was almost good she was both human had emotions and also was very intelligent in comparison to the character of Tokyo. I really hate the character Tokyo she is just the dumbest character in the entire series and she is even much more dumb then the fat buddies. she just always take the support of her boyfriend and other people to do something which is not correct and may ruin the entire plan on the other hand we have Berlin which shows much more intelligence and he is of same intelligence as the professor

Created an account just to post this review... and hopefully save some poor souls some pain. First like many reviewers have noted, I found this show based on its impressively high IMDB rating (and after watching nearly all Netflix's original content) and made the rookie mistake of not reading the underlying comments.First off, this show is (as many have noted) terrible, not trashy bad, or campy bad, or so bad its funny bad, just bad. I am angry with myself for watching the entire first season, hoping for some improvement - none comes. According to some people who for some reason have watched all four seasons, it really drops off after season two. I sincerely have no idea how it could possibly get worse than the first season.I have never seen such a promising premise fall so flat on execution. The writing is stupefying, full of melodramatic dialogue, and impossible plot holes. Also, as many people have noted this is not a heist show, it's a very badly done soap opera with a heist setting. To those who wondered if the awful dialogue is the result of poor dubbing choices, I watched it with subtitles and trust me it's not.This show is honestly, and I am not being hyperbolic here, about the level of writing as those shows that used to be on Cinemax after midnight - with a less believable plot.To the underpaid 20-something PR flacks leaving these fake reviews, please examine your life choices and do something less sleazy, like stripping.To Netflix, I understand you are in business to make money and having "buzz" and "hype" around content sells. But maybe save some money on your fake review troll farms and spend it on greenlighting actually good content. You have some, so I know it is possible.The fact that as of the time of this writing the show has the same IMDB rating as "Heat", should tell everyone with a brain what is really going on here. If there is a real person here who watched both and thinks they can justify this, please let me know how.The only positives are relatively strong production values, and some attractive people.

Review title: It's a well-written, well-acted story fatally flawed by monumental police stupidity
Review_body: And that's why it's ultimately not very good. I'm not an expert in police procedures, especially Spanish police procedures. However, I watch the news from Madrid every day and read a couple of Spanish newspapers daily. There are often articles that feature the Spanish National Police, and, in real life at least, they don't appear to be stupid - far from it. If the 'heroine' of the story, a police inspector with the usual personal life complications, had merely followed routine procedures, she would have saved a lot of trouble, not to mention probably saving some lives. That's what blew away my interest in this otherwise pretty good thriller. It's full of the usual caper cliches that require perhaps more than the usual suspension of disbelief, but the fine acting and good writing might have saved the series if only the police hadn't acted like idiots pretty much every step of the way. I can't imagine how the writer fell into such a fatal trap. I'm not a good writer at all, and, like I said, certainly no expert in police procedure, but even I would have known better than to act so carelessly around 'the worst criminals in Spain'. A big disappointment, because the series had such potential.

Can't say much but the whole thing is trash. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

The reviews are either loved-it or hated-it, and I'm sorry to say but if you hated it you probably didn't have the brain cells you think you have to understand how and why everything is happening as they are in the series and should return to watching Michael Bay movies. E.g. If you thought the professor would hire intelligent criminals, only to be betrayed with ease, YOU should be the one to which your bad review is directed and laughed at.For the people that are even a little bit educated in the dynamics between politics, media, law, philosophy and psychology this is just pure art.Not to mention the cinematography, the music, the breath-taking drama, plot (twists) and build of suspense that makes one wonder whether the series were actually produced in this era, of which the film industry has become a play-dough spaghetti maker, and not somewhere in the golden age.Dear, dear writers, directors and every one else PLEASE don't astray in season 5, you're about to make history.

Every character of this show is one of its kind i.e. A prototype. Writing, Direction, Dialouges and Cinematography are exceptional. Lastly who can forget the PROFESSOR, the mastermind. Thanks to Netflix for bringing this show in INDIA with phenomenal dubbing. What a Team ! A Dream Team. Hats off to the makers.

Review title: Amazing S1 & S2, sharp drop-off after
Review_body:
The first 2 seasons were amazing - smart, fast-paced, interesting. Then come S3 & S4 with ridiculous plot lines and twists, characters who belong in a soap opera, stupid mistakes made all the time, not suitable for experienced criminals. The whole reason the second heist is needed is absurd, but I chose to overlook that in S3E1,thinking the rest of the episodes will be similar to the previous seasons. I guess it was picked up by Netflix and ruined. I am not even remotely interested in the upcoming season and how this heist ends. But giving it 7 stars because of the strong first seasons.

The biggest Heist in the history. This is probably Netflix's best and the most successful original show. In a bold story made up, full of original ideas, excellent acting, a lot of tense moments cleverly woven with funny moments- this is the jewel in the Netflix crown. The thing that keeps this show interesting is the fact that 3 different taking place at same time and three different places - The Inspector, The professor and the Heist. GREAT!!With its unpredictable and overwhelming plot, this series so addictive that one will definitely complete it in binge watch. I have been watching it since 2 days without a break. Haha! And eating like crazy. The series revolves around a very strong, mysterious, genius yet very kind man name Sergio Martinez(The Professor) who spends half of his life planning the biggest robbery in the history with a very dangerous but capable crew. Really love the strong bond between the crew. Tokyo and Nairobi my favourite ones and ohhh How can I forget The inspector? She is super dooper great at doing justice to her character. Even in my dreams last night I was into this Heist with my friend Haha!The series just gets better and better from part one to part 2, then part 3 and part 4 is even better. I can't just wait for part 5 to come. Masterpiece indeed!Totally worth the time, attention and goosebumps throughout the series! Must watch.Are you getting bored? Don't get bored, go sign in Netflix and watch this amazing show!

The last season is the dumbest one !!!professor acted as if he was against the government n people were dumbly cheering for him no reason when they were not going to get a single gram of gold !!! A selfish thief nothing else !!waste of time !!! Only the first heist was good !!! Don't know why they added extra characters unnecessarily!! N why did tamayo listen to his demands for the exchange of brass !!! Nonsense.

Review title: It was just another disappointed show for me
Review_body:
Well how do i begin? At first seeing how the storyline goes on how they planning to rob the money in the heist ,the progress was kinda thrilling ,how they evade ,the cops how the tactics was running .I really get hype of it at first ,eventhose the spotlight is on the criminal side ,the cops still have their show to run especially Raquel who attempt to accomplish her duty on catching those thieves inside the heist ....not to mention that she was a criminologist and a physiologist.Things went smooth on how those criminal plot it and executed it for the money ...but when it comes to Season 3 ....i kinda skipped through as would eager to know how the story path roughly go ....eventually i saw Raquel was suddenly with the Professor side and the reason is Love ,huh?omg .....she gave up her high rank position to be with a criminal...This is.....for me is totally unacceptable ,misleading and joke ....Logically ,Raquel character has been played was a justice ,and will do all her best to fufill her duty ...with her criminologist and physiologist skill ,i dont think a person with that skill will get easily convinced by the professor and go with him ....it was totally rubbish......
Shes kinda weak when how she being defeated by those strategies and plan that the professor has set up but uh from a cop and become a criminal is a question and doubt for me about this show ...Moreover ,after their first success on the first money heist ,the professor eventually launch another money heist again to other bank in which the storyline and the idea is kinda similar with the season 1 .....so its like repeating which makes the show not so interest to watch the same idea anymore ..Lastly , I dont think is worth to watch as the logic of the story plot is unacceptable ..i shouldnt be so serious on this haha It was just a show ....thanks for wasting my time to watch this shows and writing comment ....totally not recommended.

Review title: Funny how US films don't get slagged off for being "unrealistic" as much as non-English stuff
Review_body:
La Casa de Papel is absolutely riveting. Anyone that can get passed the fact that it doesn't come from the UK or US and that, being Spanish, will have dosis of fantastic Latin passion, will be binge-watching.It's really original, superbly done and filled with cliff-hangers that'll make it really hard to stop watching. There are a lot of unexpected twists and turns and, even though there are some characters that you just want to punch, I suppose that is... well, part of life...I was really surprised that they did a 2nd series (3 to 6 series in Netflix terms), a 2nd robbery, because the first one ended in such an "un-continuable" way, so I was really curious to see how on Earth they were going to pull it off. But they did! And bloody brilliantly! I found the second Heist even more riveting. It is fascinating to see how the plot unfolds as well as how the intricate security system in El Banco de Espa√±a works.Like I said in the title, I read quite a few reviews criticising the lack of credibility or realism in some scenes/areas. It's an action show, for goodness' sake! Very originally and cleverly mixed with intricate relationships, love and drama, if you ask me.I've found this kind of criticism on other Spanish films, etc... before and, considering some of the outrageous stuff that is constantly coming out of countries like the US or UK, and no one seems to bat an eyelid, it all seems a bit suspicious to me ..
And if in doubt, check out the last time anyone complained about the totally and utterly, out-of-the-question stunts in any of the Bond movies (to mention one of many, many, many more...)

It's the best series someone can ever see. Please do watch it and rate it yourself, and i promise that you will be forced to give it a 10 star rating.
                
                    0 out of 3 found this helpful.
                        
                            Was this review helpful?  Sign in to vote.
                        
                        
                    Permalink

Netflix strikes again with the first part of season five of Money Heist (La Casa de Papel), the Spanish thriller where robbers, who have adopted the name of cities as their various nicknames, make a second attempt at stealing currency from the Spanish government. Even as they are committing various crimes, how the story is written invokes passion for the robbers and has led to a global phenomenon not only in the show but in reality, as it has found tremendous streaming success. Season five continues this by having viewers run through a gauntlet of emotions, it will have you excited, exhausted, upset, afraid, and cautiously optimistic.

With every episode it gets more stupid, childish and I can not even track anymore how many love stories are going on. In the middle of 2.4 billion robbery?! Jesus!!!!! Hey Netflix, this is a soap opera/science fiction and not a crime drama.Would be probably a really good show if it would end in 2 seasons but Netflix is too greedy.

Review title: La Casa de Papel is Very good series.
Review_body:
La Casa de Papel, tells the story of a shy and gifted robber who is called in the series the "professor", it is he who organizes one of the biggest heists of the century. He first attacked the National Currency Factory, then the Bank of Spain by digging underground passages and then taking hostages who were already present in the banks to keep up the rhythms inside the factories.I think the plot is very well done, there is suspense throughout the series with the different main characters. The dialogues are well done and understandable and the English voices in the series are well done. I hope to see the last season of "La Casa de Papel" as soon as possible !!

Review title: One Of The Best Web Series In The World üòòüòç
Review_body: One of the many great series on Netflix depicts a group of people breaking into Spain's national mint. "La casa de papel" ("Money Heist" in English) is a series that you just gotta see. Rapid-fire dialogue, clever editing, and all sorts of twists and turns make this one of the best shows out there.

This series is full of action but difficult to understand for a child under 12 years old because all the same the story is not so easy to understand because at times the teacher uses words can be common for children of 12 years otherwise apart from that these a very good series because there are series where the main characters are not in danger while the same main characters are in danger I really advise you to go see this series.

The character development is incredible. You almost feel like you're one of them. From the actors to the creators this show had me hooked from the first show to the last. Honestly besides breaking bad I think this is the best show ever made. I was sad when it was over because I don't know if there will ever be a show as good as this ever made again. To the creators, actors and all involved you truly made a masterpiece and I can never think you enough for what you created for all the masses around the world. Review title: For the love of God, watch it in Spanish
Review_body:
It took a bit to get into the series, with its plot holes and leaps of faith, but it's a hell of a fun ride! It's got a lot of "fat" to get through at times, with some interpersonal relationship stories that don't move the plot along, and yes, as in so many series, it loses it's thread along the way of extra seasons. But still, it's well-crafted and shot, the editing and direction do a great job of creating and holding tension, and it's a great introduction to some wonderful Spanish actors.But for the love of all that is holy, invest the time to read the subtitles and watch it in Spanish. The English dub-actors are horrible! Saturday morning Scooby-Doo level voice caricatures- I think all the males were trying to conjure up Race Bannon. Que terrible!

Review title: "La Puta Madre" de los TV shows
Review_body:
After wrapping up all the 22 episodes in a week or so, I must say I was surprised about how much it had delivered. It's not just a shallow heyst plot exercise like so manny others that came before. Even my previously favorite heyst movie - Ocean's 11 - does not make it to the likes of La Casa de Papel (although it has a somewhat similar vibe to it).
La Casa de Papel gets you full character development and empathy with any regular human, flawed and imperfect. I read on a previous review here that it made no sense that the perfect heyst had so many flawed execution on the characters part, but hey, that's life, that's what gets it interesting. Refreshing to see this kind of production coming from any other country than US or UK. On this case "nuestros hermanos" espa√±oles (I am from Portugal), present a credible spanish reality that I can relate to because there's plenty of familiarity on the characters created. So in that sense I am biased on liking it, but that's not significant for acknowledging how well it was executed! I only have to add the following, written on a similar tone as Nairobi would say:
 
¬°joder! el mas grande pu√±etero programa de televisi√≥n de la puta madre del carajo del siglo! ¬°co√±o!

I admit, like the most, that seasons 3 and 4 were unnecessary. But it was still fun. However, when it comes the fifth, i cannot find a word to define the stupidity. This is an insult to my intelligence. It a huge waste of time.

Overall, I think the show was average. I definitely got hooked into watching it through to the end because I wanted to see how it all turned out. But very early on, I realized that I needed to throw all logic and common sense out the window, otherwise I was going to start throwing things at my TV :). I feel the amount of suspension of disbelief and latitude taken here are over the top.Why didn't the police just cut power to the building? That would have immediately shutdown the money component of the heist. One might argue that a mint may have internal backup generators to counter this argument. Okay, maybe I could buy that one, but with enough capacity to run all that equipment?We're given the impression that the police continue to deliver meals on a regular basis, although we only technically see this being done the first time. Why would they do this?Hostages are left alone and unsupervised through huge portions of the show. All or most of the heist crew is often seen together in the same room while the hostages are presumably in 2 or 3 separate other areas of the mint.The whole love story between the Professor and the Inspector is so over the top. I get why it's essential to the story, but it's unfathomable that during the most important crime of the century, the Inspector would have so much free and alone time, and be totally unreachable for such long periods of time.Tokyo's motorcycle ride back into the mint just drives me crazy on so many levels. Are you telling me all of those police offers are that terrible with their weapons that they can't even land one shot anywhere on her?The Inspector takes the Professor back to the original training house instead of to the police station? Makes no sense.During all of the various shootout scenes, barely anyone (in the big scheme of things) on either side is ever injured.Why did the Professor and Berlin suddenly acquire a wireless headset connection all the way at the end? Why wouldn't they have used that from the start? This was sort of explained way that it was encrypted and would take only 2 hours to decrypt.There are probably other things I've already forgotten about. I will watch the 3rd part because I can't help myself. Like watching an automobile accident :).

Definitely a must see. This is not the typical robbery film. I have read many hard critics about the fact that the characters are dumb and make silly choices. I think that this fact males the characters more human and credible. Indeed in my opinion this makes you emphatize with them, understand them, and even want them to success. Im deeply tired of perfect-inmaculate characters, that almost make my laugh. And this show will drive you yo the edge of tears. Some scenes really seem irrelevant, some songs out of the place... But later on, suddenly, all these apparently meaningless scenes join together in a really emotional way. There were preparing you for the twist.
If you want absurdly perfect, deadly heroes, this is NOT your show. You will not find James Bond, Danny Ocean or Ethan Hunt here.Bella ciao, bella ciao, bella ciao, ciao, ciao

Review title: Scratch Action and Mystery - just put Crime and Romance
Review_body:
..im not sure why i watched this till the end.. ..maybe because the idea itself isn¬¥t that bad..
..maybe because i didn't expect so much romance..
..maybe because i had already spent to much time not knowing the end when there was more romance and love making going on then developing the story..
..but seriously..the actors aren't very good, the plot at some point just turns ridiculous (why would captors fall in love with hostages at one point..same question goes out to the police), the ending is more than questionable and theres so much insignificant stuff going an which really makes you sleepy often. i watched part II in 3,5h with a-lot of skipping....if you wanna polish up your rusty Spanish - this might me a thing. but dont expect to much..better watch something like fargo.. or WGN¬¥s Outsiders from 2016. but this is not your first choice when it comes to action, crime and mystery - in fact..can someone explain to me "mystery" here? TY.

Review title: Above the average but don't be carried away
Review_body:
After a certain point I think we need to stop being amazed that a show looks good (well done to the director of photography and the camera crew) and focus on the story. 
I wanted to binge watch something and this show was better that the average trash that is out there. But by no means this can get anything more than 7. 
The plot holes are big enough to plant trees in them, most characters are utterly stupid, do not develop and keep messing that "great plan" and although it is a close competition between the professor and Tokyo, the professor wins with his insane decision to get intimate with the worst possible person. 
There are worst things to watch out there.
