Review title: Avoid unless you're not very critical about tv series in general
Review_body: SPOILER: Immediately after watching 2-3 episodes of S01, I started getting a feeling that there's something not right about this series. I didn't want to judge on spot, so I continued watching. The more I watched, the more it turned out to be as I expected, an amateur, shallow, and weak script, performed by not so interesting characters.Berlin is good, but the others are meh.So, this series about a robbery that has been supposedly planned for so long, yet you discover how foolishly it is managed and operated. Many times you see 5-6 kidnappers out of 7 in one room, and you wonder, who's left watching the 40+ kidnapped persons.The operations room where the detective runs the rescue mission detects any telephone signal within a 30 meters area, yet the assistant manager had a voice recorded injected in his eyeglasses, and he's at the tent, but nothing triggers any warnings! It's not a static voice recorder, it's TRANSMITTING voice signal to the professor!Lots and lots of simple and stupid overlooks like that make me question the capabilities of the director/writer/producer. I'm not a police officer or IT expert, but I mean it's common sense to consider such details. It blows my mind to see such TV series and similar movie being rated 8+ on imdb. How? Just HOW?

Review title: Great idea destroyed by poor plot development and implausible situations
Review_body:
Watched season 1 and 2, which is a finished unit. I do not plan to watch further.First, the good stuff: the basic idea is great as well as some of the twists. Also, characters were well developed and consistent. But...More often than not plot development is poor as it is too far from approximately solid ground. Some actions taken by characters are outright stupid or unnatural to the situation and would never happen to experienced robbers that were chosen and trained for half a year. Same goes for the police officers side.
Sometimes characters do actions that do not make any sense, only to fulfill the criteria that is required to drive the plot further to the desired direction (e.g. Denver's real gun exposure makes no sense).
Also Professor's ideas require series of coincides to happen. Not one or two events, but series of them.Of course, I get that some of mentioned is necessary to make things interesting, but in this series, it is used to the extent where it becomes untasty. Most of the situations just do not hold the water.
Also, 3 days into the heist there are already so many romantic relationships going on, it is disgusting.Be warned that the series are loaded with cliffhangers, so often you can't help yourself to watch another (mediocre) episode. For this reason, I don't even recommend you to start with it. Trust me, if your brain is not numb, you can't appreciate these series.Also, I have to mention that overall I've skipped 4 (shorter Netflix) episodes (carefully chosen by description) and never had a feeling that I've missed something out.
Best that I saw!!!! You should to see it, you will feel everything that you will see in this series. In couple days I saw 2 seasons and I hope it's not will end. Love it! Recommending

Review title: Bunch of impulsive & emotional fools on a heist.
Review_body:
Bunch of impulsive & emotional fools on a heist. One time its acceptable. But why planning heist with same members. In the first season, throughout the season I was thinking, Professor could have hired 2 thieves more for the heist who could do his jobs outside of the bank and monitoring chamber. Why he always going out every time and heist is going for toss now and then once he steps out. They form a rule but nobody cares about it. Probably that's what writer and director wanna show. That Professor is not so smart, police can catch him now then if they have a will to do so. All they need is to come out of their monitoring rooms. Within minutes we have seen police uncovering professor's hideout in single episode. But then you wont have so many chapters and successful heist. Enjoy the show. Its one time watchable. Everyone acted superbly in this series. Background scores are fantastic. Lets see when they are able to release chapter 5.

Forget the plot holes and the lack of logic for some of the story... this show show really sucks you in. The sets are so rich and full of character, filmed so beautifully. The music expertly interwoven... a blend between classical, folk and modern.... above all, the characters and acting is just stunning.Alvaro Morte would win an Emmy if he was in the US. His amazing delivery, his pauses, the way he is able to portray his thoughts and feelings through his eyes is just incredible. He even found a way to fix his glasses on his face in an interesting way. Equally awesome is Pedro Alonso and the scene between him and Alvaro singing Vela Ciao will make you wish you were their brother!
This show is just awesome.

Then I want to hear you say La Casa de Papel is even close in terms of quality, acting, plot, intrest.So many plot holes, so many predictable moments. Don't fall for the hype. Review title: Honest review of an amazing series
Review_body:
I could not stop watching episode after episode, because of the clever cliffhangers. It is a beautiful series full of action and drama. I like the symbolism and rawness of the series. However, some decisions of certain characters felt "out of character". But when you decide to accept those choices of the characters, you really can't stop watching, at least I couldn't. I love the way we get to know everyone and how the series becomes more "personal" in part 3 and 4. Because of the flashbacks, you really get to know the characters and I felt somewhat confused when I actually started to see the main characters as the "good guys". It is interesting to realize how society makes us believe that "good and bad" is like "day and night". But the series show us that everyone is just human with their own problems and motives. There is no strict line between a bad person or a good person.
To conclude, the acting is azing and the series is definitely worth watching if you like a smart, thrilling and emotional journey while sitting on the edge of your seat!

Money heist starts off as a breath of fresh air, a superb story full of plot twists and excellent performances. The professor becomes a household name across the world and every costume party has men and women with Dali masks and jumpsuits in them. I'd rate the show at 9/10 up until the second season. It's a pot full of gold for Netflix and then the greed steps in. The returns season after season and it's only so many plot twists one can have with the same characters and concept. Everything feels like a drag now. The Heist pulled off is the one on Netflix. The best OTT platform feeling the heat of competition and trying to keep the cash registers ringing. Ah, the con is on us.

Review title: Disappointing, and although not deserving of a 1 star rating this SHOULDN'T HAVE an 8.5+ rating here on IMDB
Review_body:
Many, I included, use this platform as a way to be efficient with time and try to seek out what would seemingly be the best TV-shows and movies with little research needed. Apart from niche types of films which are either loved or hated, IMDB used to be a very reliable source, but as time passed and as it grew in popularity, we see more and more instances of unworthy titles getting flooded with 10-star ratings which (sometimes) get balanced by just as many 1-star ratings, leaving you with a funny inverted Bell curve. This isn't how things SHOULD work, but unfortunately, this is what we get.Let's start with the good first. I initially found the story interesting, since the general plot is original and ingenious. And that's about it. This could've been a great series, so let me tell you where I personally think things went wrong: 
It all starts with the writing. The writing is ATROCIOUS. As I stated above, although the GENERAL plot and story were great, as the entire thing unfolded mistakes upon mistakes started piling up, forming plot holes, hilariously impossible and nonsensical scenarios. The characters seemed all one or two-dimensional, and most never even saw the shadow of any sort of character development. As I kept watching I soon came to realize that this show was made to be mindlessly watched, catering to the masses with their daily dose of sex, violence, and tension, while delivering very little substance to reflect on. And to make all of this worse, couple it with some (very) bad acting (not sure because of the directing or the actors themselves). In the end, La Casa del Papel is entertaining for those who seek to procrastinate filling their time with nothingness, but if you're actually looking for a complex and well-written TV-Series you might want to look elsewhere. (the two best examples of this I could give are Westworld S 1&2 and/or True Detective S1, a true masterpiece).
True rating: 5/10

Exciting start but they cant't keep up the excitement during the episodes. I like to watch Casa, but it becomes predictable.

Review title: I didn't know this show was that good!
Review_body:
Fascinating! I never thought that this show is that good. What made it a good experience for me was a few different reasons:
1. The pacing of the series: It is the first time that I watch a show were 5 days take place in only 19 episodes. There were some episodes were we get to live only an hour or two in the world of our characters. There is no single scene that has no use or convenience to the plot, also not a single boring one. Each conversation or incident happens for a reason that develops the characters or for us to learn things about the world of La Casa de Papel or the characters.2. The realism of the human nature: Our characters are not perfect. The writers use that lack of perfection in favor of the development of the characters. Police members not being perfect. Gang members not being devils and 100% bad.
I really liked this show. I'll give it 8/10. However, there are some aspects that kind of ruined it for me, especially at the end of season 2. For example: some characters being too smart - sometimes unrealistically - and other that should be smart are behaving very very naively that it was not convenient to me.

Review title: Totally unrealistic. An average heist show at best
Review_body:
I really like heist movies and I thought I was really going to like this show. I watched both part 1 and 2 and in the end this show proved to be a hit and a miss.
Positives
Most of the times it is entertaining if you don't take it seriously.
Some of the actors are really good.Negatives
Huge plot holes. I will not mention all of them because it would take too much time. For me they completely ruin the main story.
*** WARNING Spoilers ahead ***The biggest plot holes resolve around the so called "intelligent" Professor:Why does he tell Angel where he lives? Or at least, in the vicinity of where he lives. Because Angel shows up on his front door soon after that.Why does he let Angel in his hideout??? This makes no sense whatsoever. Angel can not be sure that Salva is in the building. He could be out, he could have the wrong building. It is really easy to simply not open the door. Angel does not have a search warrant. Also at the same time there was a crisis in the heist so it makes even more sense not to let him in. Still, he lets him in and this allows Angel to take his fingerprint and test the cider. This decision causes the coma of Angel and also lots of suspicion from Raquel.Why does he let Tokyo take part in the heist? She is completely unstable, cannot take orders or stick to the plan. She is a ticking time bomb and should be nowhere near a heist. Also why does she go back to the Casa after she was set free by the Serbians? A place surrounded with police, snipers and trained gunmen... By some miracle she is not shot (seriously, how can they miss her?) but she still ends up causing Moscow's death.Why is he alone in the hideout? He hired Serbians but only uses them towards the end. The only smart way to handle the heist is to stay put in the hideout and let the Serbians do the dirty work like remove fingerprints from a car they used or dig. He should have also kept Rio with him in the hideout. The guy is a dead weight in the heist but is a hacker so could be useful working behind the scenes.Why didn't he let the Serbians dig the hole further towards the vault before they even started the heist. Perhaps someone would notice the noise but i doubt it. Even so, he could have asked the Serbians to start digging again the second his team enters the Casa at the beginning of the heist. El Professor keeps saying that gaining time is key to the success of the heist. Focusing on digging seems obvious but again, this focus comes only at the end.Why did he make Berlin the leader of the heist? He definitely has leadership qualities but he also ordered a kill of a hostage when there were many other options. Also, the guy is a maniac and litterly rapes a women on the show. El Professor keeps saying that the public needs to approve of the heist but that is difficult with a guy like him. (the character Berlin was a very interesting character played by an amazing actor and a great addition to the show but it just doesn't make any sense to pick him as a leader).How did he escape to the Filippines? They know how he looks, he was even on TV. They could have easily closed the city streets. And as an extension, the borders/airports etc.At the end El Professor says that his plan was perfect except for the fact that he fell in love with Raquel. But of course this is complete horse crap because his plan was ridiculsly flawed. It was actually a miracle (and bad police work) that so many of them got out.The list goes on but you get the point. I can take a few plot holes to force the story to go from point A to B but in this show has a crazy amount. The show simply lacks realism.

If they would just concentrate on the heist and quit showing so much about their goofy personal lives, it would be much better.

Review title: Firsr Two Seasons are awesome but last two.....
Review_body:
Because of the language barrier, I didn't pick this show at first. But I saw a lot of recommendations for this show. So I started to watch. First two seasons are mind blowing and only thing in my mind was, "Why didn't I watched this series before". So I continued to watch the third season. Though it got some similarities with the first two season, I enjoyed it. But the last season was totally waste of time. If they drag the same story like this, people will eventually get bored. So I think it's time to finish the 2nd Story line and start a new story line apart from the first two.So If you are looking forward to watch this show, I really recommend it. First two seasons are mind blowing. So first watch them. After that. no argue you are going to watch the other two seasons. Then you decide what you are going to do with the upcoming seasons.First two seasons 10/10
Third Season 8/10
Fourth Season 5/10Thanks

Review_body: I think this was one of the best series i have seen so far. Didn't like Nairobi death though. All characters were amazing.

Review title: Season 1 amazing, Season 2 very hard to watch
Review_body:
The show starts off really well, hooking the audience on the plot of the perfect robbery. There's great acting from lots of at the time fairly unknown actors (at least to me) and in general the cast seems like a great fit for their characters.For season 1 I would call this a really good series with very few things one could criticise. Towards the end it starts to drop off a little though with things feeling stretched out a bit.
With season 2 it all starts to go downhill. I won't spoil anything but it really becomes very cringeworthy to watch, it almost feels like someone wrote a parody on romance and action movies. It continues to become less and less believable to a point where I personally just gave up and let it happen waiting to see the end. Especially at the very end there's a scene with the main protagonist and it was so embarrassing to watch, it made me feel embarrassed about telling my friends how great this series is after watching the first couple of episodes.It feels a little like the writers were pushed to add a second season and add more drama and excitement through stupid and stereotypical action scenes. Unfortunately this is not suitable to just watching the first season so the series is ruined by the second half, definitely a real shame.

Review title: an average melodrama with horrible writing disguised as a heist show
Review_body: The creator of the series had the right idea and a lot is done right.Writing, however, is what absolutely ruins the show. My problem with it is that every character in the show is an absolutely obnoxious idiot who couldn't mug someone in a wheelchair let alone pull off the "biggest heist in history".Characters feel like they we're written by a six year old's kid definition of a 'bad man'. These people are portrayed as the top criminals in their line and fail to convince you so every chance they get. The professional thief doesn't know what fingerprints are, the hacking prodigy leaves a hostage alone with her phone to discuss relationship with his girlfriend, the impulsive fightstarter backs down from anyone who speaks to him in a tone (including hostages). Half of the events wouldn't happen if the characters were not morons.Everyone is overly melodramatic and get butthurt over minor things instead of focusing on what they need to do. As the title says, it's a melodrama not a heist. The show tries so hard convincing you there's tension but there isn't any. Not a single action has any consequence, the characters are not presented with difficult choices. The only thing that seems to be in risk are the fragile feelings of the main characters.If you're familiar with the concept of show don't tell, money heist is the opposite. All tell and no show. Hard to believe that this has such a high rating. I watched the first season and hoped it would get somewhat better in the 2nd but it somehow got way worse.Don't waste your time.

Totally a waste of time, could not watch after 1-4.

After all the hype surrounding Cas de Papel, I decided to give it a try. I won't lie, at first I was hooked. The whole concept of this "impossible heist", the mysterious plan, the interesting characters and the tension gets you invested. But as the show progresses, the plot seems to start to drag, the show switches over it's focus from the actual heist, to the all the love stories going on. And trust me, there are a lot! Everyone of the characters seem to find the love of their life, all while casually robbing the Royal Mint of Spain. Even more, the heist-men suddenly shift from following the plan they had been preparing for 5 months, to not caring about it at all. Especially some of the heist-men's behavior just becomes irrational and childish. Don't get me wrong, I am willing to overlook some details in an action show, but this series requires you to completely switch off the logic in your brain in order to watch it after some point. For me, this show feels like the writers had a good idea, and then just didn't know where to go with it, ending up with a bunch of cliches.

Review title: should have kept it short and simple
Review_body:
A series with an interesting idea for a heist that becomes dumber and dumber the longer it lasts.The characters could have been better written and many of them are inconsistent. Betrayals and plots are planned only for the plotter to have a last minute change of heart and confess everything just in time to foil any situation that may end the heist. Characters that are moments away from killing each other seem to be perfectly at peace (or in love) a few hours later, as if nothing happened.The police handling of the situation is shockingly unprofessional on all levels. Following the hostage escape the policemen on site stand passively and watch for a few minutes instead of storming the breach, giving enough time to the robbers to barricade themselves again.The officer in charge takes time off what should be the most important case of her career to grab drinks and sleep with an unknown man. Not even when there is ample evidence that she might be sabotaging the investigation is she put under arrest. In season 1 and 2 we are lead to believe that she is a tough professional, a woman in a men's world that had to prove her worth time and again, yet she is constantly displaying poor judgement, lack of professional pride and unprofessional conduct. Instead of turning the Professor in as soon as she uncovers him, she decides to interrogate him alone, with predictable results, although she had been warned that the Professor might be proficient at hand to hand combat. The story appears to be pushing her into an absurd they-lived-happily-ever-after love affair with the one person who outsmarted, violated her privacy and humiliated her at her job.Not that operational security matters for the robbers either: some don't shy away from taking lovers from among the hostages and sharing the plans with them, and the others robbers don't seem to mind that.In spite of all the shooting there are only a few casualties, and this makes the series feel like some Saturday morning cartoon, where not even the bad guys get hurt. While the robbers may be firing intentionally wide, the police appears to be suffering from Stormtrooper level marksmanship.The criminal mastermind gets lucky and escapes so many close situations that I actually began rooting for the police to catch him. He is the team leader, yet as the series advances it's obvious that he lacks leadership skills and cannot impose its will on the team. He's got a tearjerking story attached (as most of the robbers have) to divert the viewer from the fact that not only is he's a crook, but he's also greedy and full of vanity as well, given the sheer amount they're stealing.
To be honest, I expect him to be robbed by the Serbs.Overall, the series is just like a heist - the longer it lasts, the more likely things can go wrong. Looking back, the idea is fine for a movie, but unsuited for a multi-season TV series. From season 3 the story is just implausible, the plan becomes more and more unrealistic with every convolution and the characters make absurdly poor choices.Just watch something else...

The show will keep you on the edge of your seat, and you really get attached to the characters. I know there's a lot of symbolism, and for many people it's about resistance. But to me the best parts were the love stories and the redemption of certain characters. I loved the acting of Pedro Alonso Ochoro (Berlin) and especially Alvaro Morte (El Profesor). All the acting was excellent, from the entire cast. I usually like tragic endings when I watch a thriller, because it's more realistic. But with this, you're rooting for the characters so much that you're hoping there won't be a sad ending. I've recommended this show to everyone I know.

Review title: Utter B*** S***!! Thats what it it..
Review_body: Sure, the idea of the show is smart and entertaining: a bunch of elite criminals working together to rob billions of dollars. Some of the characters such as Berlin are professional and smart, which is good for the plot. It could have been a great series. But the show went downhill after Tokyo's relation with Rio is introduced. Their love is not reasonable at all and Tokyo kept using love as an excuse to ruin the plan of the entire team, putting everyone in danger but did not pay for her mistakes. Besides, there are just so many plot holes in the show that I don't want to spoil here. The police are totally dumb and useless that they deal with the criminals in such stupid and inefficient methods. Many of the characters in the show does not help develop the plot but just annoy the audience so much, one of them being Tokyo who is so immature and arrogant which kept bringing trouble to the whole team. The actions of the characters are simply not understandable and the show simply doesn't deserve such a positive rating. I would have given it a better rating if not for the annoying characters and plot. Such thrilling topic simply doesn't mix well with undeveloped and sudden emotions and love between the characters.

This show is great, it has action, suspence, drama, mistery and comedy in it.
The show reminded me of one of my favourite shows, Prison Break.

For example: criminals turn off all phones in the building so that they don't get hacked - one criminal makes a mistake and let's hostage use the phone for 2 minutes - the police hack into it and use the camera to identify criminal. Literally the next episode a few more phones are turned on and waved around criminals faces but nobody seems to.bw afraid of hacking nor do the police detect any phones being on. God dang it!!Wasted time and nerves... Don't watch unless you're a bored, immature soap opera lover.

Review title: Not perfect but still an interesting TV show to watch
Review_body:
To be honest, i've expected so much when i watched the very first scenes.I imagined to see those pro experts criminals run a genius robbery plan. But it all fell down since Tokyo's appearance.
This show absolutely have so many unlogical flaws like there're many scenes that we can't see any members watch on the hostages (??) The fool of some member (Tokyo & Rio, somestimes Denver) make us feel very disappointed and annoying.
But on the other side, i have to say i love this show. Why? Because i love Berlin's consciousness, professional and super cool attitude of Nairobi (You don't know how much i love her!), the brilliance of Professor's genius head and i feel so pity for the inspector Raquel.So with this show, i still annoy with stupidity of Tokyo & Rio (I sympathize for Tokyo cause she's iconic in commercial side) but i also thrill to see what will happen next. I do see many flaws but yet i still love this show.

Review title: Throw your logic out the window before watching this show
Review_body: Like everything in this generation, I discovered this TV show through hype. It was going viral, on my Netflix home screen, on twitter, everywhere. So, I decided to give it a try. I feel disappointed I wasted my time on this show. I'm not a fan of fantasy shows like Spiderman, Superman, Batman etc. Honey Heist is a mirror image of super hero movies, difference being the crew here is a bunch of bad guys. I'm not a fan of fantasy shows because of the imbalance, one side is extremely strong, smart, has all the powers available right on time and other side is simply dumb. In this show too, it's the same, the cops are dumb and incompetent. The cops in this show have all the equipment, fancy gears, intelligence power, yet they screw up worse than a third world country cops, not once but multiple times, come on, are the Spanish cops really that bad? Could the makers not make is somewhat believable? The Royal Mint of Spain is under siege and the top cop is going on a dinner date? Having an affair with the main accused? Oh my, that is some level of soap opera right there. And to top it off they dragged what could have been a mini-series to 4 seasons. Learned my lesson, don't jump on the hype wagon, do your research before wasting time on something like this again.

Review title: Turn brain off, easy to follow action series. 7.5/10
Review_body: My first review of a tv series, yet alone European series. Honestly I have to say I rather enjoyed the first two seasons and have listed all the pros and cons below:Pros: The series are well paced and they lead into each following episode nicely. Great acting particularly from the characters Berlin and the Professor. Great score and limited CGI is rather effective. Locations on all sets (filmed in Spain) are wonderful.Cons: Too many chiefs and not enough Indians, basically there are so many changes and shifts in both the bank robbing group and Spanish Police it's laughable. The two main police/detective characters are the biggest imbeciles you could possibly witness. The firearm/weapon action scenes throughout the series are so over the top and unbelievable it personally prevents me from giving this a 9/10. Honestly Tokio/Tokyo (main character) manages to hit targets with her back turned, running backwards and single handed. The show would have been fantastic if they hired a firearms advisor.All in all I would suggest giving this series a go if you have a few hours to kill. The characters Arturo and Angel are so pathetic it's honestly fascinating to watch them spiral out of control.

Wonderful show.... All the characters are played well

Review title: Well-written, great character development and depth, excellent staging and editing!
Review_body:
This show feels like theatre, packaged.
I think the bad reviews give it the thumbs down because they're expecting a more modern/moderate approach to cinema.
I agree, plenty things are pretty dramatic, exaggerated (in terms of emotional reactions), and the characters along with the plot follow a "normal" fairly formulaic, arguably predictable, story arc.
...but I love that the characters are named semi-anonymously because doing so objectifies them by labeling and strips people off the complexity of our humanity. Having said that, this show exposes itself of the flaws of having one-dimensional characters by using its own characters interact with one another and get to know them deeper than the roles they have, in the given context while still in the act.
The pacing of the acting along with the editing, too, is astounding. The actors act with their eyes, own their respective characters' personalities while showing that they act differently around various scenarios and people.
Many decades ago, fast cutting in editing was frowned upon although many avant-garde filmmakers were already using it (mainstream tends to be behind with these things). It wasn't until later that it became common although I find that too many productions overuse it (montage sequences, which aren't all that bad, which isn't very often)... but when you give it just slivers within the right moments to depict an emotional and mental state of the characters in given stressful or ecstatic moments? Brilliant.
It also mixes the old (folk European music sang by the robbers when they were rejoicing about finding soil) and the new (technology, costumes & wardrobe, shot in present time), politics and how scandals/heists come into play with diplomacy...
I can go on and on about how much I love it both for the eye candy and the socially charged messages (meat) but I think you should go check it out yourself and see if you agree or disagree =)

Review title: Do not be fooled by the rating.
Review_body: This is not a good show by any stretch of the imagination. Plot-holes, continuity errors, disregard for veracity (I mean, the Serbian mercenaries and the assault-squad police actors grab the weapons incorrectly, and that's just 1 small thing).Browsing through comments, you can find many dupes, even the same comment 5 times: "masterpiece", "as good as breaking bad". These are certainly bots.I told my wife, this series is so poorly written and directed, that it's like they had in mind an audience that doesn't question anything and is content by being spoon-fed cliches and ridiculous mini-cliffhangers in each episode, you know, like our moms and aunts, a non-critical audience that doesn't know any better.This is truly a waste of time and the high ratings are evidently the result of tampering, DO NOT BELIEVE ANY RATING ABOVE 5 STARS.

Review title: Not the greatest heist series ever
Review_body:
There's no better time to watch season of this epic heist series. With quarantine and everything going in the world, it won't hurt to watch something exciting. In fact, it would hurt to NOT do something exciting.Season 4Episode 1: At this stage we're just happy to continue watching the series, and get the chance to witness the cliffhanger left in the previous episode. Apart from Berlin's song (highlight of the episode for sure), and the professor's colorful display of emotions Tokyo's guts (she's always full of em), I would say pretty much forgettable.Episode 2: Where the plan starts going downhill, largely due to Palermo's doing. And between his subtle but effective start of a character transformation, to Denver's love troubles and some Jaw breaking moments (literally) between Marseille and the professor, I'd say pretty much interesting all round and Promising, (Apart from Arturo's disgusting presence that is.) Signs of things to come.
Episode 3: Finally, the reemergence of the Professor we all fell in love with. Tokyo at her peak, her vulgar remarks making the episode more interesting, Some worthy quotes and superb dialogues and finally a cliffhanger worth the wait. Impressive, bar the beating up of 'the fat guy' in the bathroom scene which is totally unnecessary.Episode 4: Some highly choreographed action scenes. Delightful watching Stockholm's demonstration of leadership skills. Some top notch performances and exchange by Gandia and Berlin. The scene about the business of managing the economic crisis was gotten wrong, if you ask me. The beginning of the of Sierra's character evolution. Stellar performances and pretty much enjoyable, except the mere presence of Arturo which is meant to deepen our disdain for him. And it did.Episode 5: One of the most brilliantly written and intensely packed episode. From nice action scenes to a semblance of emotional connection and full of surprise. Between Tokyo's exchange with Gandia, and that exquisite Nairobi's pose? We wouldn't have wish for a better episode.
Episode 6. Nairobi's big re
veal kind of spoil her impending doom, which makes it less emotional when it finally arrived. A pivotal change in the relationship between Denver and Stockholm's relationship, maybe for the better. Brilliant planning (as always) by the professor who so far seems to have been dozing. Moving.7. The whole team Still a little bit weary from the death of Nairobi. A befitting tribute to Nairobi. Subtle show of emotion by Sierra. Apart from the suspense at the end? Tiring.8: The most marvelously written and acted episode and the one for Major reveals. From a pivotal change in the image of Palermo (probably to sacrifice him later on), Sierra's bombshell and once again a remarkable show of leadership by Stockholm, a departure from the woman we saw being manipulated by Arturo in the start of the Series. Oh and perhaps a nail in the coffin for her relationship with Denver. Once again an uninspiring attempt of evoking our emotions. Finally, a worthy match to the professor in Sierra, though credit must be given for his articulate planning of the rescue mission. A delightful performance by Manila and perhaps we'll get to see more of her in coming episodes. Not much of a cliffhanger at the end though. I mean we all know Sierra won't do anything rash seeing as she is a persona non grata herself but will instead switch to her own best trait; negotiations. An undeserving end to Gandia too. Apart from those, what an intensely charged and highly choreographed episode! Memorable.In conclusion; Largely shallow plot details, but we can't help but marvel at the depth of the character transformations. Now that we seemingly understand Palermo's plight, we might even come to empathize with him. One can't help but get enthralled with Rio's boyish charm and innocence, and impressed with Stockholm's leadership streak (future heist leader?) and be saddened by Lisbon's growing irrelevance and the professor's seeming aloofness (which says a lot about how the heist might ultimately come to fail) and Tokyo's...well Tokyo being Tokyo. And Arturo, really? To think that we though a character couldn't be more despicable. Throw in another two more seasons with this below par performance, and they just might lose their fan base.

Better then much other series
I hope this series will be continued..

Review title: Promising plot let down by poor subtitles
Review_body:
The series starts well, a plot to pull off a spectacular robbery. However the whole thing is letdown by the subtitles. I like to watch foreign (to me) ie non-English films and tv series, in the original language. This seems to have had its subtitles translated by google as they are often clunky and bear no relation either to the original Spanish or to the English audio also provided. An example, where the chief police negotiator refers to the robbers as "heist men". Really? Could the producers not have found fluent translators to have written this stuff?
Later on it gets cliched with cookie-cutter plot lines and twists. Halfway through I am at the point where it would be as tedious to stop as go on, so I shall battle on, if only to see who's left standing at the end.

Review title: It could be watched as a parody
Review_body:
My first review here. And only because I was lured by some friends to watch it.Well, you know the feeling you have, when you start to want all the protagonists to die? In this series this is what you will think most of the time if you don't fall asleep.Most of the things are done childish wrong because this suited the script writers. You can see this in every episode.You are hyped to see this genius plan by this genius "professor" and what you get is a soap opera with deux ex machina that saves the day.The professor is not only a "genius", he is also a kind of super agent that can solve any critical mistake in a matter of minutes or even seconds.I believe there is no point to start numbering the obvious plot holes. It would take 10 pages at least.The hardened (teenage looking) pro robbers have no issues to come in sexual relations with the hostages. Really? I thought they are all committed to their cause driven by personal dramas that would make them work like a machine.
What you get is teenage behavior that would make this story end badly for them in episode 1.The most ridiculous scene so far was this one: There is a robber-girl (Nairobi) that is telling her drama at Tokyo. (She lost her child and now wants the heist to succeed so she can get it back.) She is crying and very depressed.
And what they are doing next? They are drinking Tequila, get dressed like they would go out to lure men, start twerking and slap each other's asses.Nice.

This is one of the best series I've ever seen. Truly Mindblowing... I can watch it over and over again. great acting, I literally couldn't sleep after watchting this masterpiece!
A must watch!

Review title: First part is good, second not so much
Review_body: The first heist (Seasons 1 and 2 where I live) was great and had a very satisfying ending. However, due to the huge success, they decided to make another season and while it still has fun moments, it's not great anymore, I'd personally not even call it good. The characters are not believable anymore, everything feels extremely forced. While the first heist certainly had moments where I thought to myself: "Why in gods name are these people behaving like idiots?", in the second heist I rarely find myself watching a single episode without cringing at their dumb, erratic behavior.Another huge issue are the action sequences, especially in Season 4 episodes 5 and 6. They are just horrible. About as realistic as action scenes in Fast and Furious or Transformers ... but cheap looking. Completely ridiculous.Overall, the huge decline in quality made me pretty much lose all interest I had in the show. 6/10 just because the first heist was very fun.

It is imperative that in any TV show that when you stretch out the story that it often gets sillier or you try to repeat the formula that made it successful in the first place.The second heist did just that, it was a more difficult heist with higher stakes and the problems they faced were bit of a stretch on the imagination [e.g. Palermo healing quickly after getting glassed in the face, a nearly invincible head of security, Professor boxing in the middle of a problem, finding the person who tortured Rio and making him confess nonchalantly, and Lisbon's escape plan is just silly (although the fake wall was clever)]I must say, without the problems they faced and often silly contingencies, the plan so far is amazing, it's almost like a really good Ocean's heist movie. Part 3 did really well in setting up and showing the technicality of the heist.Part 4 I would roughly say is mostly flashbacks and 2 steps back on the whole series. I would agree with most people who didn't like part 4.But here's why I still gave it an 8: despite the silliness, the drama, the character development and the payoffs are what keeps you on the edge.e.g. Palermo's arc is amazing and drew parallels to Berlin's rise/fall/redemption and his relationship development with Helsinki, Sierra's feistiness and problem solving nearly matches the Professor, Denver/Stockholm ups and downs,and my favorite: they know how to kill off a character properly. first, the head of security promised it and did it in a kind of expected but slow motion build up that makes you nervous. Second, the other characters mourning was given enough time so she doesn't just die and everyone moves on. Nope, they mourn long enough with you. Third, the payoff was great, to use her death as what they called "a missile" and the throwback tribute they gave to her, Moscow, Berlin, and Oslo.

Review title: Too many firearm inaccuracies, too many things flying out of left field
Review_body: The show is entertaining enough, I'm only on part 2, but firearm inaccuracies really bother me in films and shows. A simple Wikipedia search is still more accurate. Example: in part 1 when the ambassadors daughter points the rifle at Rio, there is no magazine in it. She claimed to be an experienced hunter with her father, her form is decent, but all tough she says there's still one in the chamber and proceeds to pull the charging handle back. If there was one in the head it would have been ejected from the chamber. Typical Hollywood making movies with firearms who have never even held one no less shot one. Also, some of the "developments" are just too ridiculous. First 2 seasons are somewhat entertaining. Not something I would watch again or go crazy over.

Review title: Where does the hype come from?!
Review_body: I've started watching this as the idea sounded interesting with quite some potential when seeing a series filmed in Europe. But, my God, the characters do loose touch with reality and common sense already during season one. By mid season two I could no longer see this. In all honesty, do we really have to have the "bad guys" completely useless when enforcing something, taking revenge or even facing each other? Do we really have all the women in this series falling flat on their backs, in love with the perps? And does the Spanish Police, in real life, act like this? Meaning...will an arrest happen when the perp surrenders as he gets bored from being caught 10x? Another soap opera that disappoints more by creating actually an expectation to get something different...

Review title: Bella Ciao Bella Ciao Bella Ciao Ciao Ciao
Review_body:
Watched this Spanish series last week.thankyou Netflix, have to say that Season 1 and 2 are Excellent. I loved the role of Professor, Nairobi, and Berlin. The plot is superb and keeps you on the edge of your seat.
.
Characters are superb and all actors have done a good job. With the way it ended in season 2 the expectations for season 3 and 4 were set high as everyone knows, there will be someone somewhere making some mistake. So, yeah I was ready for it.BUT the 3rd and 4th seasons of the series ended up failing the expectation. Maybe because the plan was flawed and not set by the professor. So might be they made it look crazy?
.
The bar scenes from the past between Professor, Berlin, and Palermo were felt a bit stretchy. Arturo was not at all required but don't know if he will be utilized properly in upcoming seasons?Of course, there was a need to kill someone but WHY Nairobi? Maybe the character had grown strong and popular, so they thought to shock the audience? Just like #GOT may be... But then eliminating Monica could have been better as no one knows about her past (to increase emotional attachment of the character, director could have build the character and killed it) and that she was pregnant! Would have sent equal shockwaves.Too many bullets were fired on Gandia but none of it hit his prone body parts. Was he wearing bulletproof pant? What about the head? Ok, agree that the director did not want the Heist team to kill any civilian because then it would have turned them from thieves to murderers but a bullet on legs or arms could have done the work.Hopefully, they come up with better execution of the plot in season 5 and 6 and maintain or exceed the expectation which was set by season 1 & 2. But please give a beautiful and logical ending to the series in season 6. I won't mind if the series ends in Season 5. Thing is that don't drag to make it lose its charm.

I absolutely love this show! It's exciting and suspenseful with romance and passion! I can't get the song bella ciao out of me head! So excited for part 5

Review title: Enjoy mindless afternoon soap operas? This series is for you!
Review_body:
Upfront: this is a Spanish series, and I'm an American who watched this on Netflix with the English dubbed over. It's likely much more appealing in Latin markets, but missed the mark for me. The initial few episodes are intriguing, as they set-up what appears to be a relatively intelligent heist series. What develops is a melodramatic soap opera with pathetic character development and plot holes galore. If you enjoy mindless afternoon soaps, this series is for you. If you're looking for an intelligent crime thriller, do not let the first episode sell you like it did me. I'm disappointed in myself for having wasted the 20 or so hours and laughed at 90% of Season 2 to get myself through to the end.

Review title: Very drawing plot with a few points on the nose
Review_body:
I thoroughly enjoyed the first season currently out, and while I generally felt satisfied with the events of the plot, there are certain points where it felt the plot got into a corner and the writers just added flashbacks in order to say that the mastermind accounted for everything. It's convincing in the way his character is portrayed, but laughable at some points. Also the closing line of the first episode almost made me not want to watch the series due to how cringy it is. Don't be dissuaded, this is a very well written story showing perspectives of the hostages and how they view events even though the audience knows differently. They don't keep the audience in the blind and allow the audience to truly feel a step ahead of the police along with the gang. I would definitely recommend watching at least the season that is currently available.

This series gives a lot of great messages. First of all, Dali masks are not an ordinary choice. Dali is a genius painter who inherits community life contrary to moral and common traditions. He never accepted the society's obligations and the right to misuse ethical rules. The masks represent this irregularity.
The red overalls represent socialism (communism). The thiefs are socialist comrades and they are fighting.
The royal mint and cops represent capitalism. In capitalism money makes everything. Even morality will make money. When someone attacks the money, these people are declared bad. Here they are attacking money. When it is attacked by money, capitalism is fighting against the aggressors through armed and visual means.
The professor symbolizes the scientific point of view and accounting. In the end, scientific thinking and responsibility come from the top of all kinds of problems. But he succumbs love.
I have not seen such a meaningful socialism in a long time. Moreover, the plot was used by the Salvador Dali tactic. You think you're watching the events, but each time you have a deep meaning and a message.
Berlin is a sort of socialist struggle that is on the verge of resistance to the death scene and that it leads and hand in hand with the woman. The song Ciao Bella also symbolizes socialism.
Great job. It's not just a movie or a script. It is a wonderful work as a philosophy. There is a big slap in the capitalist system.

I'm extremely impressed with the plot and cliffhangers that occur every episode. Starting Part 3 now and haven't lost interest. Amazing producing.

If you like Prison Break, you will love La casa de papel because both of them are awesome police series that you can¬¥t stop watching until you end it. Certainly the most impressive thing in the series is the plan that Professor created and the things that he knows and the ones he made up out of the blue. 
 Beyond the violence and the desire to steal the money, the series talk a lot about love, and forbidden love. A philosophy that the series shows is that in some cases love ruins everything because some people could not get involved, but some of them do, and this can be really bad for the plan.
 One thing that is really commented in the series is about how family is important; how some people can lose their minds if they do not have a present family and how people can fix their minds too with someone of his family by their side.
 In general this series is fantastic and really original, some of the things that happen there I would never have been able to think about by myself. I really recommend it.

Review title: Forced suspense to get watchers hooked and damaging gender stereotypes
Review_body:
The show has its merits. The camera work and aesthetics are very well taken care of. I enjoyed it as a visual experience.
The problem are the characters and the story.
In a similar way to the TV series "Lost", at the end of each episode there's a forced suspence-generating situation. This is not bad per se. What I didn't like is that the suspense situations most times get resolved quickly in the next chapter and in an absurd way, in a deus ex machina style, without any intelligent plot integration.
About the characters, I found most of them very irritating. Many times during the show I thought "how silly/ridiculous is what he/she's doing!".
Most women are depicted as impulsive and irrational, and only men display an adult use of their brain without the interference of their hormones. This promotes gender stereotypes. Why can't women think coldly and rationally? The main female inspector is particularly irrational and careless about respecting police protocols.
Also the spanish police is depicted as very incompetent. Most of their snipers wouldn't be able to hit an elephant at ten meters of distance.
I believe that this show is overvalued, or that most rankings aren't coming from a trustworthy source, otherwise I cannot understand the hype.

Very good plot. But production and acting could use some Hollywood skillsets.

Review title: what a fun ride - one of most entertaining shows to date
Review_body:
I've read some silly negative reviews so I've felt compelled to write something for those who can't decide whether to watch or not and who might have given too much importance to otherwise lacking negative reviews of the show here. This show does not take itself seriously and that's its strongest point and that's why it's easy to forgive so many things that would be unforgivable if the show was made under pretense of a serious "perfect" heist of the century. if you expect such show you better skip this one - it's not for you - you'll be disappointed...most likely. All the main characters are broken and vulnerable people with a number of personality quirks, they are really caricatures of the professional master criminals. You could say that the show to some extent in that aspect parodies the genre especially movies and shows made in the US. There is no such thing as a perfect plan, it's human to err, it's human to love and fall in love, to sin and seek redemption. It's good when the show made in Spain gets soapy and adds some of that special Latin Telenovela flair to the suspense of the series. Well tempered melodramatic parts of the show work really well with playful cast who have obviously enjoyed themselves while on the set.The music theme of the show "My life is going on" explains the crux of the narrative.
it's a love story wrapped in the heist inside The House of Paper. ;)

Eine der besten Serien die ich je gesehen habe... sehr sehr spannend. ;)

For a theme that has been widely covered in movies and shows, Lacasa De Papel is refreshingly unique. Any fan of Prison break or shows of that ilk will enjoy the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of this show. Every show has its flaws, and while there are some unrealistic moments, it is still an enjoyable watch. The acting was phenomenal, (big up to Pedro alonso for his part as Berlin) the plot was exciting and unpredictable and the action itself was thouroughly entertaining. 
This show had so many twists and turns that even in the episodes where not a lot was happening, I was on edge because there was just no way to tell what was going to happen next.The reviews bashing this show are mostly about slight innaccuracies and minor plotholes, don't listen to them. Listen to me. Lacasa de papel is intense, emotional, and action packed. One of the top 3 shows I have watched for sure, and I generally don't enjoy movies/shows in other languages. The only thing I would say is if you plan on watching this show, don't watch it English dubbed, it takes a lot away from the brilliant acting. Use English subtitles instead! Enjoy! Bella Caio!

Review title: If you are an anayltical person with some brains, you will utterly hate this show
Review_body: Which is my problem.This show is meant to be for a very broad audience. If you watch it with an analytical mind (having some basic understanding about the world history and culture helps) you will go crazy.There is so many cliches, (from phrases, to historical events, music, etc), its just insulting at some point. Every cliche you can think of, cliche phrase, cliche term was used in this show. You will notice those.But then again, some normal behavior is altered to fit the story and to fit the events. There are so many different, completely unnatural reactions in the movie, that would absolutely never be possible in real life.Police in the show, represented somewhat negatively, are just plain stupid and naive. I dont see any other reason to make the decisions that theyve done.And this is throughout the whole show. In every episode, i found 10-20 things that annoyed the living hell out of me, frustrated me, and just plainly made me angry for spending time for watching it.If you do watch it, do not overly think or go into analysis "why, how, what". Just watch, and you might enjoy the audio/video production value. Which is the only reason i wont give it 1/10. It looks modern.

Review title: This is a story of love in all its forms ...to watch season 2 as it will unravel
Review_body:
Having viewed both seasons. - season 2 much more catchy and well developed than the first one, my review is that this series intends to be a powerfull love statement.of course the robbery is what appeals and intrigues everyone but I see it as secondary 
We have father son love between Sergio and his father as he is the one who fulfills his father lifetime plan and also between Moscow and Denver which is a sacrificing love. Also sacrificing love is the one between brothers. I am speaking about the powerfull connection between Sergio and Andres. 
Andres is my favourite character as he shows multiple layers to his personality and the actor is briliant. The last scene with him and the dialogue with sergio is absolutely wonderful and the music is just perfect.
Beside the love for his father he trully has a love for the weakests, for the repressed, as well as Sergio. Their idea was not to get rich for the sake of being rich but to give the world a robin hood feeling, stealing from the rich and so on. The rich being the capitalist society ruled by bankers.
What gives soul to this series and the reason why you cannot quit it even though there are many loopholes that get on your nerve are the love stories. 
Monica and denver is the unforseen love but in 5 days it has everything From hate to love and sex and friendship
Rio and tokio have a disfunctional relationship toxical at some points but nontheless enjoyable 
Season 2 is most about sergio and rachel. The actors deliver the perfect tensional love hate relation
About the theft. Yes there are manyyy many errors related to the techical aspects or the storyline, the scrips that seems stupid or just funny if you view them a bit relaxed but there are also some nice turnarounds events. some more plausable than other, that do the trick and make you want to see more.
My conclusion after this loong review is that the directos do a good job at depicting the characters and thier relations and a mediocre job at the actions that surrounds them, from where the major flaws come from.

Encourages robbery and and all sorts of illegal activities in the name of justice, why would anyone steal public money from a bank and take it for themselves instead or giving it to the poor if they call it justice. I wouldn't be surprised if this show bred more burglars and thugs. Also the actors are hypocrites they are Zionists, if they truly are just they should have supported the Palestinian cause.

"La casa de papel" is an interesting case: a series that's written to be gripping and exciting yet at the same time doing it in all the wrong ways. It presents itself as the story of "the perfect heist" - a robbery so meticulously planned that the only way it could fall apart is if the people executing it botch their jobs really badly.Guess what happens? Six out of the nine people involved botch their jobs badly, including the mastermind.Fortunately, everything works out to the result of maximum suspense. Unfortunately, that happens at the cost of throwing away logic in more than one place. Not that you'd really mind if it were done ironically, or at least with a little self-awareness of the increasingly over-the-top developments. But the series insists on its own seriousness again and again, even when it has clearly gone beyond logic and went into A-Team ridiculousness.What holds this series together is a group of talented actors, if you do not count Tokyo, who seems to know only one facial expression, very much like a female Nicholas Cage, except when she's having a breakdown. All the others sell their scenes convincingly

Addictive, intriguing, intense and of quality. A masterpiece of television.

After listening to so much praise for Money Heist (La casa de papel), I came into this series with enthusiasm. Unfortunately, that enthusiasm quickly faded after seeing the first episodes. The story seems to have been written with some misogyny, presenting erratic, impulsive and thoughtless female characters, who fail every time they are in charge of anything. It is impossible to empathize with any of the characters, because they are all equally despicable. The lack of plausibility of some facts becomes laughable: elite police sharpshooters who cannot manage to shoot a single criminal, even when they are only a few meters away, and those wounded by bullets who miraculously recover in a few hours.There is a whiff of communism that justifies the robbery of the National Mint, because the banks seem to get richer and richer as the people become poorer and poorer. Actually, it seems that for these modern-day Robin Hoods, the problem was not what the banks were doing; it was merely that they were not the ones doing it. This was their way of achieving "social justice." Therefore, they decide to print millions of euros to distribute among themselves, "the poor wretches" of the criminal gang. The main protagonist is, without a doubt, a beer company, Estrella Galicia, that accompanies the characters from the beginning to the end. I hope that the third season never arrives. Stay away from it!

I almost never write reviews, but this show requires one. If you like intellectual suspense, this has to be the best show made in a very long time. The tension between the Professor and the Inspector, as low key as it is on the surface, becomes overwhelming. I found myself routing for both of them, though in truth probably more so for the Professor. It is difficult to convey just how good this show is without revealing too much. When the series finally ended it felt like I just had finished a hard sprint. I now am going to watch for anything with the same writers, directors, and actors. They clearly are an "A" team. My only suggestion for the writers and directors - you do not need so much skin in skin scenes or use of the "F" word. Both might be commonplace in hollywood, but the phrase "hollywood standards" is a term of derision most places outside hollywood.

Review title: Oceans 11 meets George of the Jungle!
Review_body: I'm stunned at how bad this series is, from the outset it tries too hard to portray that 'cool' image of bank robbers, immortalising them into something they're not. First of all there's zero character development, its straight into the action, no planning, no build up, no suspense. Just straight through the front door all guns blazing, its a terrible plan that is so unbeliebable its literaly unwatchable. Secondly there's the acting, its not just bad, its really bad, it doesn't help that the script is awful too, sounds like its written by the guy who didn't get the job at writing the first Rambo movie.And finally the whole thing is filmed through a gritty filter, washed out colours, dark, moody, but it doesn't create the intended suspense its supposed to, its just annoying. I had to create an account just to vent at how bad this show is. Worst show I've ever seen on Netflix by a country mile.

Seems like a soap opera specially after Season 2. Season 1 and Season 2 are also not in the league of greats. Overall its a below average series with a brilliant premise

It certainly has a deeper meaning and the makers of this show have found a great way of delivering it to us.There is not much to say about it. Even the actors where great and their acting was so believable that makes me wonder why many of them don't have a career in Hollywood...This show is smart, it delivers great messages, it has great tempo leaving you no time to get bored or anything and you will absolutely feel thankful for watching it!Excuse me for any grammar mistakes, English is not my native language.O bella, ciao! bella, ciao! bella, ciao, ciao, ciao!...

Just hope that after being owned by Netflix won't lose its great features.

Review title: Entertaining but very inconsistent and not credible scens
Review_body: The series is entertaining. But I can't stand one thing, you are supposed to be amazed and entertained by how smart and well thought out the thieves and the cops are. And this really is not the case when almost every single smart id√© works because of one thing, and in the next episode, they break that one thing or rule that made the trick work. The series is very inconsistent within its own rules regarding the story, and that makes the entire "smart" thing broken and less entertaining. In some situations, the thieves have every little detail thought out, and just skip other dilemmas that would be huge problems for the cops and the thieves. When you really want to see whats gonna happen, and how the characters will solve the ongoing small situations, they often cut the scenes and skip forward in time. This feels like a really cheap way to force the story in the specific angle they want it to go, rather than let it play out as it would do in real life. With more interesting dilemmas, emotions and a story which would probably not go in the direction they skipped forward to. A third thing that really waters out the series and makes it much less exciting is the never-ending flow of standoffs that literally leads nowhere. Many times two or more totally different opinions arguing. And they don't come to a collective agreement at all, and still, the story goes on as if they did. Until they reach a new dilemma with different views, and after some fighting, the story goes on as if they all agreed to do the same thing. And a fourth thing that bugged me. The crew that made the entire heist looked like a bunch of incompetent children compared to the squad of serbs that arrive at the end. This really reduces the original crew to zeroes and makes the point of the series regarding uncontrollable emotions look like a simple unprofessional trait. And why would not the professor use the Serb squad for the entire heist?! He had literally 5 months to see that the other team were too emotional and different to be able to cooperate smothly.

I LOVE IT.
THIS WAS AWESOME.
THE BEST TV SERIES I'VE SEEN EVER.
MUST WATCH!
FROM BANGLADESH ‚ô•

The show started with promise and the concept was good. The first few episodes were not bad but by the second season it was seriously dragging and I couldn't wait for it to end. I felt like I was invested given that I watched the first series to go to the end but the end actually makes the whole series look much worse1) The professors only mistake was falling in love. What? He made so many mistakes. Why did he start talking to Angel and let him into his factory? Why do he appoint a bunch of morons to do the heist? Why do he only use the Serbs at the end? 2) Most of the characters are morons. The inspector is in the middle of a major heist with national coverage and spends half her day getting coffee or hanging out with a guy she just met. She has a daughter too who she leaves with her Mum with Alzheimers? She also changes her mind every 2 seconds and just because she saw a red hair on his jacket she knew that he was now the killer instead of someone she fell in love with after 2 days? What?3) The romantic relationships were ridiculous. Tokio and Rio makes no sense at all. Monica, supposedly a refined, smart lady falls in love with a total moron after 2 days and then starts shooting at the police officers? Really? The other girl starts sleeping with Berlin because she is scared even though they act like they are all mates half the time and bring them pizzas (from where?)4) How many stand offs can you have? It was obvious they weren't going to shoot anyone so why did they keep pointing guns every two seconds. It loses its meaning when you do it every 2 seconds. Also why did Denver shoot Monica in the leg? He could have just not done that and I think everyone would have been OK with that it was not part of the plan and is very unnecessary.I could go on all day.By the end you hate all of the characters and you will happen they will all take each other out just to end the show and make sure they don't do another series.

Is what this series is. And it is beautiful, in its almost childish naivety which some mistake for lack of skill and logical inconsistencies. Yes, some plot points are ludicrous, the first of which is the basic premise of the series, that it is really possible to rob la Casa de Papel. It is not, otherwise it would have been done in real life and we would know about it. In my opinion, this series is not about a heist. It is about the underprivileged, downtrodden and losers entering the place where money is printed to reveal us that it is essentially what it is called in Spanish - A house of paper. And to show us what they are in their essence - just people who crave for love. Those whose intellect is above such shallowness, seeing only plot holes and cheap melodrama, please explain how on Earth could, for example, Jesse Pinkman phone Walter White and vice versa without getting them both caught? There was no triangulation in Albuquerque? The first time we see the real Heisenberg, when he blows up Tucos headquarters, the series has seriously jumped the shark as both of them are alive and WW gets away with it. The methalamine which was on the train robbed in the best tv series in history and around here, is easily made at home. Does that make BB a bad series? Of course not. The richness of the characters, ethical ambiguity and eternal themes it addresses compensate for minor flaws of the plot. La Casa de Papel does not pretend to be as serious as BB, but it does have a message. A truly humane one. And as subtle and subversive as Bella Ciao. It is the reason why people love this series and come here to recommend it to others. Not because they are paid. Money is paper, after all. Even Walter White had to acknowledge that fact in the end.

Review title: The Golden Rule of the Heist...
Review_body:
Is to Buy Time. And boy, does this series do it. Season One crawls along, and instead of wrapping up everything in a nice little bow by Episode 13, nah, fooled you, we're gonna continue on, and on, and on. So many Suspension of Doubt in the story-- like the Professor somehow hooking up with Raquel, lead investigator on the case. Or Denver hooking up with Monica-- as if Stockholm Syndrome pops up in a few days, esp. after the victim has been shot in the leg, after learning she is pregnant by the wimping min director who first says he has no intention of leaving his wife and three kids, only to suddenly say, yeah, Monica, you're the one for me.
If this had wrapped up after one season, I would have written it off and said, okay, some good, some bad, but not worth watching the remaining two Seasons.
Not sure why it is rated so highly. The script and plot lines should have been edited with a weed hacker.
This is like The Never Ending Story, it just keeps going on, and on, and on...Should have ended after about ten episodes.
And brought to you be Estrella Damm beer...with product placement everywhere!

Review title: Don't waste your time on this!!!!
Review_body:
Either most critics lack basic brain functions, or most critics were paid. I can not imagine any serious intelligent adult who would actually finish watching this series, look back, and then rate it anything above above 2/10. I mean... seriously!
If you are still watching it, thinking it will get better, more logical, pieces will come together: it won't and they won't. Nonsensical until the very end. Do yourself a favour, and watch anything else instead.Only one example: how could Raquel let the Professor escape TWICE while holding him at gunpoint? She never considers calling her colleagues? Do the right and logical thing: solving the kidnap? Or do the writers suggest she fails to take him in, because she subconsciously loves him under her raging anger, and therefore fails more or less intentionally??? Please, do not insult any viewers with more than two brain cells...Netflix, I am dissappointed: with the series and with the rating system. Pffff....

Somehow on a beautiful plot they were able to mess up the story line. It seems like the guns police have are not working, and the police dog can't smell, making everything one sided without any logic or proper reasoning. I am rather mad on this than disappointed.

Review title: My friend forced me to watch this, who was tricked by the reviews
Review_body:
First things first!
Ratings do matter.
My friend, who trusts IMDb ratings, found out that La casa de papel has got a fair amount of 10s and thought that it's a good film series to watch. But boy he was mistaken.
Let's start from the fact, that these robbers are not smart, but very stupid and incompetent indeed. Main character, Tokyo is so stupid and acts like she's got no experience in her criminal life. In the very first series, she almost makes a mistake, which even I would not do.
The series is full of nonsense, if a human gets shot millions of bullets, one should die, right? hm.. not in this series..
Why would I even want to watch this silly stuff? I still finished it hoping that it would be interesting at the end. I was still mistaken.

Review title: I'm mesmerized and sad, that it's over!
Review_body:
It's 4AM and I still want more! But wow just WOW. This was the best series I've ever seen. I don't even speak Spanish. How the director/creator put this together just amazes me that there's that level of brilliance out there somewhere. It's a series that will make you feel every emotion. It's a series that will make you click next episode even though you know you should be getting to bed. It's the only series that not only I've written a review for, but going to watch all over again, right away.

Palermo,this is a war,act accordingly" are the last words we hear the Professor say during the end of season 3.All money heist fans undoubtedly remember these words.Since 8 months,all the fans are preparing to take part in this war by simply sitting in pyjamas and binge watching season 4.Finally,season 4 has released on Netflix and I have finished watching the entire season.
Season 4 starts off with heaps of tension and drama as Nairobi's condition is critical and the Professor has lost his mind due to the well-planned fake execution of Lisbon on the orders of Sierra.Nothing seems to be going according to the plan.All the robbers are in a worrisome situation as the Professor is not able to come up with a new plan which has never happened before.Meanwhile,Inspector Sierra is on the top of her game and all the moves are hitting the bulls eye.
It is ironic that the series is presented in such a way that we root for the bad guys and curse the people who are trying to catch/kill the robbers.This is what makes the series special.Each and every character has an unique personality and the character arcs are beautifully drawn.The writer successfully writes an almost flawless script for season 4.All the actors manage to pull of an amazing performance.
Money Heist is not just a series,it is an emotion for its fans.Thus,the expectations automatically sky-rocketed for Season 4.I can confidently say that Season 4 lives up to its expectations.It does not have a single boring moment.All said and done Season 4 of Money Heist is a perfect blend of tension,drama,action,emotions,cheap thrills and dark humor.Like the first three seasons,Season 4 is also a masterpiece.Don't miss it.Ratings-4.5/5Guys this is my first review so kindly ignore some flaws.Let me know if you found it helpful
